One day, the bunny met a big bird. The bird could raise its wings and fly high in the sky. The bunny told the bird, "I am scared of the dark. Can you help me not be scared?" The bird said, "Yes, I can help you. When it gets dark, I will raise my wings and fly with you. We can see the moon and the stars together."
That night, when it got dark, the bird raised its wings and flew with the bunny. They saw the moon and the stars together. The bunny was not scared anymore. He was happy and thanked the bird. From that day on, the bunny and the bird became best friends. They played on the hill every day and night, and the bunny was never scared of the dark again.

"Hi, I am Rollie," said the large ball. "Do you want to play with me?"
"Sure, I am Sparky," said the little spark. "I can light up and we can play together."
Rollie and Sparky played all day. Rollie would roll and Sparky would light the way. They laughed and had fun together. They played hide and seek, and Sparky would hide in small places where Rollie could not find him. But when Sparky lit up, Rollie could see him and they would laugh.
As the sun went down, Rollie and Sparky said goodbye. They knew they would play together again soon. Rollie rolled home and Sparky went to light up the night sky. They both had a very fun day.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was deaf, but he was very good at understanding what people said with their hands. One day, Tim's mom gave him medicine to make him feel better. Tim didn't like the taste of the medicine, but he took it anyway.
One day, Tim was playing with his friends in the park. They were playing a fun game of catch. Suddenly, Tim's friend threw the ball very far. Tim ran as fast as he could to get the ball. When he picked it up, he saw a big red button on the ground. Tim was curious, so he pushed the button.
The button made a loud noise that everyone could hear, except for Tim. The noise was so loud that all of his friends decided to quit playing catch. They all ran to Tim and asked him about the noise. Tim didn't know what they were talking about, but he showed them the button. They all pushed the button together, and the noise stopped. Tim's friends were happy, and they went back to playing catch. Tim was happy too, because he could still have fun with his friends even if he couldn't hear the noise.

Lily and Tom are friends. They like to play in the sand. One day, they see a big boat on the water. The boat has a flag with many colors.
"Look, Tom, a boat!" Lily says.
"Wow, where is it going?" Tom asks.
They run to the water and wave at the boat. The boat stops and a man comes out. He has a hat and a smile.
"Hello, children, do you want to see my boat?" he says.
"Yes, please!" Lily and Tom say.
The man helps them get on the boat. He shows them the rooms, the kitchen, and the toys. He gives them juice and cookies. He tells them stories about the sea and the animals.
"Where are you going, sir?" Lily asks.
"I am going to a lovely island. It has many trees, flowers, and birds. Do you want to come with me?" he says.
Lily and Tom look at each other. They think of their parents and their home.
"Thank you, sir, but we have to go back. Our parents will miss us," Tom says.
"OK, I understand. But maybe you can visit me another day. Here, take this map. It shows you where the island is. It is not far from here. You can stand on the shore and see it," he says.
He gives them a map and a hug. He helps them get off the boat. He waves goodbye and sails away.
Lily and Tom run back to the sand. They look at the map and the water. They see a small dot of green.
"Is that the island?" Lily asks.
"I think so. It looks lovely," Tom says.
They smile and put the map in their pocket. They decide to keep it as a secret. They play in the sand until their parents come. They are happy.

Tim and his mom filled a big bowl with water and added some salt. They gently placed the paper boat on the water, and it floated! Tim was so excited that he played with his boat until bedtime. Tom and Lily are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they see a big dog. The dog is brown and has a long tail. The dog runs to them and wags its tail.
"Hello, dog!" Tom says. He wants to pet the dog. He reaches out his hand.
But the dog does not like Tom. The dog growls and shows his teeth. He bites Tom's hand. Tom cries out in pain.
"Ow! Ow! Ow!" Tom says. "The dog bit me!"
Lily is scared. She does not know what to do. She sees a man nearby. The man is wearing a blue shirt and a hat. He has a leash in his hand. He is the dog's owner.
"Help! Help!" Lily shouts. She runs to the man. "Your dog bit my friend! He is hurt!"
The man is sorry. He did not see the dog run away. He pulls the dog away from Tom. He says sorry to Tom and Lily.
"I'm so sorry, kids. My dog is not friendly. He does not like strangers. He should not have bitten you. Are you okay?" the man says.
Tom is still crying. His hand is bleeding. He needs a band-aid.
"It hurts a lot. I need a band-aid," Tom says.
The man is helpful. He has a first-aid kit in his bag. He takes out a band-aid and puts it on Tom's hand. He says sorry again.
"Here, this will make it better. I'm very sorry, Tom. You are brave. Can you forgive my dog?" the man says.
Tom looks at the dog. The dog looks sad. He lowers his head and whines.
Tom is not angry anymore. He knows the dog did not mean to hurt him. He says yes.
"Yes, I forgive your dog. But he should not bite anyone else. He should be nice," Tom says.
The man nods. He thanks Tom and Lily. He says he will train his dog to be nicer. He says goodbye and leaves with his dog.
Tom and Lily hug each other. They are glad they are okay. They decide to play somewhere else. They do not want to see the dog again. Not yet.

One day, the ship saw a little boat. The little boat was lost and scared. The captain said, "Don't worry, little boat. We will help you find your way."
The big ship started to speed through the water. The little boat followed behind. The captain looked at the sky and the stars to find the way. The little boat was happy to have a friend.
At last, they found the little boat's home. The little boat said, "Thank you, big ship and kind captain. You are very compassionate." The big ship and the kind captain smiled. They were happy to help their new friend.

Once upon a time there was a good boy named John. He played in the park with his friend Lucy. They liked to skip and run around and laugh.
One day, when they were in the park, Lucy saw something shiny and pointing out from under the ground. John bent down to take a look and saw that it was a Pretty Chain. He went to take it but Lucy said "Wait, John! It might not be safe. We should go and tell an adult."
John thought for a moment and then said "No, it's okay. I want it. I will take it."
John knew the chain was clear and shiny and he wanted it badly so he took it. But when he touched the chain something strange happened. John was suddenly pulled into the ground and disappeared.
Lucy started to cry and called out "John! Come back!" But he didn't. The chain had lead him somewhere else and he was never seen again.

Once upon a time, on a sunny day, a little boy named Tim and his dog, Spot, went to the beach. They loved to play in the sand and splash in the water. The beach was their favorite place to have fun.
One day, Tim and Spot decided to have a race on the beach. They were both very fast. They ran and ran, laughing and barking. The wind blew in their faces, and the sand felt warm under their feet.
But then, Tim tripped on a shell and fell down. His knee was hurt, and he started to cry. Spot stopped racing, ran back to Tim, and licked his face to make him feel better. Tim smiled and hugged Spot. They walked back home, happy to have each other, even if they didn't finish the race.

Once upon a time, there was a grumpy old tree. The tree lived in a big yard with lots of soil. The tree was always sad because it was alone.
One day, a little boy came to the yard. He saw the grumpy tree and wanted to help. The boy got some water and poured it on the soil. The tree felt better and started to smile.
The boy and the tree became friends. The boy would support the tree by giving it water every day. The tree was not grumpy anymore. They were both very happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Jerry. He lived in a big house with a nice garden. Every morning he would go out and play in the garden. He especially liked to watch the birds flying through the sky.
One day, Jerry saw a bright, new style of bird. He watched it swoop and soar through the sky. He waved to it and the bird waved back.
Jerry felt the urge to follow the bird and so he followed it all day. The bird flew far and wide and Jerry kept up as best he could. Eventually it flew up so high, thatJerry couldn't follow anymore.
Jerry was sad, but tried to stay positive. He walked slowly back to the garden and sat down, watching the sky for any sign of the bird. Suddenly he saw it again, coming right towards him and landing in a nearby tree.
Jerry looked up and smiled. He knew what the bird wanted. He ran to the highest point he could find and jumped off, spreading his arms like wings. He felt the wind beneath him and he felt free. He knew he could fly if he just believed.
Sure enough, Jerry flew! He soared up higher and higher until he caught up with the bird and flew in perfect unison. They flew like this all through the day and into the night, until finally they began to fall.
Jerry and the bird fell slowly back to the ground and the bird flew

Once upon a time, there was a lady who lived in a small house. She had a big, ugly hat that she loved to wear every day. The lady liked her hat very much, even though it was not pretty.
One day, the lady went for a walk with her hat. As she walked, she met a little girl. The little girl looked at the lady's hat and said, "Why do you wear that ugly hat?" The lady replied, "I like my hat, even if it is not pretty."
The lady and the little girl walked together, and they did not let the ugly hat disturb them. They became good friends and had lots of fun. From that day on, they always played together, and the lady's ugly hat never bothered them again.
<|endoftext|>


Anna loved to sing and dance. She wanted to perform for her family and friends. She practiced every day in her room, with her teddy bear as her audience. She made up her own songs and moves. She felt happy and proud.
One day, her teacher said they would have a show at school. Anna was very excited. She wanted to show everyone her talent. She told her teacher she would sing and dance. Her teacher smiled and said, "That sounds wonderful, Anna. But remember, you have to share the stage with your classmates. Everyone has something unique to offer."
Anna nodded, but she did not listen. She thought she was the best performer in the class. She did not care about what the others would do. She wanted to shine by herself.
The day of the show came. Anna wore her favorite dress and put on a big bow. She waited for her turn. She saw her classmates perform different things. Some read poems, some played instruments, some did magic tricks. They all looked happy and confident. The audience clapped and cheered for them.
Then it was Anna's turn. She ran to the stage and grabbed the microphone. She started to sing and dance. She sang very loud and fast. She danced very wild and hard. She did not look at the audience. She only looked at herself. She thought she was amazing.
But the audience did not think so. They did not clap or cheer. They looked confused and bored. Some covered their ears. Some whispered to each other. Some left their seats. Anna did not notice. She kept singing and dancing.
When she finished, she expected a big applause. But there was none. There was only silence. She looked at the audience. She saw their faces. They looked unhappy and annoyed. She felt confused and sad.
Her teacher came to the stage and gave her a hug. She said, "Anna, you have a beautiful voice and a lot of energy. But you did not perform well today. You did not share the stage with your classmates. You did not respect the audience. You did not enjoy the show. You only cared about yourself. That is not what a performer does. A performer gives and receives. A performer listens and learns. A performer celebrates and appreciates. Do you understand?"
Anna nodded, but she did not say anything. She felt ashamed and sorry. She realized she made a mistake. She wished she could do it again. She wished she could be a better performer. She wished she could be a better friend.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue wanted to be independent. She wanted to understand many things on her own. Sue liked to learn and play.

Sue was happy to understand about the steel. She felt more independent now. She took the steel and played with it. Sue made a pretend house with the steel. She was very proud of her house.

There was a stadium full of people. Jim was one of the people there. He had a creative idea. He wanted to steal something from the stadium. He knew it was wrong to steal, but he didn’t know what else to do.
Jim walked around the stadium, looking for something to steal. All of a sudden, he saw something he liked: a special pillow. Jim ran to the pillow and took it. It felt nice and soft in his arms. He was so happy!
But then a tall man saw Jim stealing the pillow. He said, "Hey! That's not yours. Give that pillow back!" Jim didn't know what to do. He was scared, so he ran away.
The man was mad, but Jim kept running. He was so fast that the man couldn't catch him! When Jim was finally safe, he hugged the pillow to his chest. He was sad too, because he knew the right thing to do was give the pillow back. But Jim was also happy that he was so creative!

Once upon a time there was a little girl called Lila. She had long, golden hair and a beautiful smile. She loved playing in the garden with her stuffed animals.
One day Lila asked her mom if she could take a step out of the garden. Her mom smiled and said yes, but Lila had to be extra careful and not wander too far away.
Lila was very excited and began to walk around. She saw a butterfly flying around and chasing after it, Lila soon arrived at a big, green field.
She made a request to the butterfly, “Can I have a ride?” The butterfly stopped, and nodded its head. Lila got onto the butterfly’s back and she felt like she was in a dream.
The butterfly flew around the field, going up and down and around trees. It was so peaceful. After a while the butterfly landed on a big tree and with a gentle wave it said goodbye.
Lila thanked the butterfly for the harmless flight and she walked back home. Her mother couldn't believe her eyes when she saw Lila coming back! That's when Lila knew that it was worth to take that step.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Mary who wanted to be a dancer. Every day Mary would practice very hard, but even with all her hard work, she still made many mistakes.
One day, Mary was practicing very hard and became very frustrated. She threw her shoes in anger and they landed in some mud. As Mary looked at her shoes, her mom came and said, "Mary, why are your shoes so dirty?" 
Mary replied, "Mommy, I was trying to be a dancer and I made some mistakes, so I got mad and threw my shoes."
Her mom said, "I know you are trying your best, and everyone makes mistakes, even the best dancers. But why don't you own two pairs of shoes? Then you can practice without getting them dirty."
Mary smiled and said, "Yes Mommy, I will remember that next time!" 
Mary was so glad that her mom helped her and from then on, she owned two pairs of shoes. Now every day when she comes back from her dance practice, she can put on her clean shoes and go about her day without worrying about having to clean her dirty shoes. To this day, Mary is still practicing hard and dreamed of one day becoming the best dancer she can be!

Sara and Ben are twins. They like to draw with crayons. But they have only one box of crayons. Sometimes they share the crayons. Sometimes they quarrel over the crayons.
One day, Sara and Ben are drawing on the floor. Sara wants the red crayon. Ben wants the red crayon too. They both reach for the red crayon. They pull the crayon from each other. The crayon breaks in half. Sara and Ben are sad. They like the red crayon. Now the red crayon is broken.
"Look what you did!" Sara says to Ben. "You broke the red crayon!"
"No, you did!" Ben says to Sara. "You pulled too hard!"
They start to cry. They are angry with each other. They do not want to draw anymore.
Mom hears them crying. She comes to see what is wrong. She sees the broken crayon. She sees Sara and Ben with tears in their eyes.
"What happened here?" Mom asks.
"Sara broke the red crayon!" Ben says.
"Ben broke the red crayon!" Sara says.
Mom sighs. She hugs Sara and Ben. She says, "Crayons are fragile. They can break easily. You have to be careful with them. And you have to be kind to each other. You are twins. You are friends. You can share the crayons. There are many colors in the box. You can make beautiful drawings together."
Sara and Ben stop crying. They say sorry to each other. They hug Mom. They pick up the crayons. They find the blue crayon. They both like the blue crayon. They decide to share the blue crayon. They draw a big sky with the blue crayon. They are happy. They smile.

Sam is very good at basketball. He throws the ball in the hoop every time. He is fast and strong. Tom and Mia are amazed. They observe how he plays. They want to learn from him.
"Wow, you are so good, Sam!" Tom says. "How do you do that?"
Sam smiles. He says, "I practice a lot. I watch other players on TV. I learn from them. Do you want me to show you some tricks?"
Tom and Mia nod. They are eager to learn. Sam teaches them how to dribble, how to pass, and how to shoot. He is kind and patient. He helps them when they make mistakes.
Tom and Mia improve their skills. They have fun playing with Sam. They are not slow anymore. They are fast and smart. They thank Sam for being their friend and their teacher. Tom loved rockets. He had many rockets in his room. Some were big, some were small, some were red, some were blue. He liked to play with them and make them fly in the air. He wished he could go to the moon in a real rocket.
One day, he saw a big rocket in the park. It was shiny and silver, and it had a sign that said "For Rich People Only". Tom wanted to see the rocket up close, but he was not rich. He was sad. He waited until no one was looking, and then he ran to the rocket. He opened the door and went inside.
The rocket was amazing. It had many buttons and lights and screens. Tom touched everything. He did not know what they did, but they made funny noises. He felt happy. He sat in the pilot's seat and put on a helmet. He felt like a real astronaut.
Suddenly, the rocket started to shake. Tom heard a loud voice say "Countdown to launch: 10, 9, 8, 7...". He was scared. He tried to get out, but the door was locked. He screamed for help, but no one heard him. The rocket lifted off the ground and flew into the sky. Tom saw the park, the trees, the houses, and the people get smaller and smaller. He cried. He wanted to go back home.
The rocket went higher and higher, until it reached the clouds. Then, it disappeared. No one knew where it went. Tom was alone in the rocket, with no one to help him. He did not know what to do. He wished he had never gone inside the rocket. He wished he had stayed with his rockets in his room. He wished he had listened to the sign. He learned a hard lesson: rockets are not for playing. Rockets are for rich people only.

But one day, when the sunset was about to end, something strange happened. The sun began to vanish! It seemed like the sun was fading away and could disappear forever. Everyone was so scared and worried.
Suddenly, right before the sun vanished completely, a magical thing happened. The sun came back and the sunset was beautiful again. Everyone cheered and smiled, thankful that the sun had not gone away forever. 
From then on, everyone remembered the fragile sunset and all the lessons it had taught them. They were thankful for each new day and the sun's return.

But when Tim tried to put the icing on the cake, he made a big mess. The icing went everywhere! Mom was not happy. She said, "Oh no, Tim! Look at the mess you made!"

Tom and Sam are friends. They like to play games. One day, they see a big rat in the park. The rat has long teeth and a long tail. It looks scary.
"Let's play a game," Tom says. "Who can get closer to the rat? The one who gets closer wins."
Sam is afraid of the rat. He does not want to play. He says, "No, Tom. That is a bad game. The rat can bite us. We should stay away."
But Tom does not listen. He wants to win. He says, "Don't be a baby, Sam. I will go first. Watch me."
Tom walks slowly to the rat. The rat sees Tom. It makes a loud noise. It runs to Tom. It jumps on Tom. It bites Tom on the arm. Tom screams. He falls to the ground. He cries.
Sam runs to Tom. He tries to help him. He says, "Tom, are you okay? I told you it was a bad game. We should have stayed safe."
But Tom does not answer. He is hurt. He is bleeding. He is not okay. He does not win. He loses.

Once upon a time, in a small home, there was a bar of soap. This soap was unknown to many, but it was very special. It lived in the bathroom next to the sink. The soap loved to play with the water when people washed their hands.
One day, a little boy named Tim came to the sink. He wanted to wash his hands. Tim turned on the water and picked up the soap. As he started to wash, the soap began to shoot bubbles! Tim was so happy and laughed as he played with the bubbles.
Tim told his friends about the unknown soap that could shoot bubbles. Soon, all the kids in the neighborhood came to play with the soap. They loved to wash their hands and watch the bubbles shoot into the air. The soap became a friend to everyone, and they all lived happily ever after.
<|endoftext|>

Once upon a time there was a brave girl named Jane. She loved playing outdoors in the sunshine. One day, she went to walk along the beach. She stumbled across something curious - an empty sea! Jane could not believe her eyes. 
She took a few steps closer to the sea and saw a small fish caught in a net. Without hesitation, she jumped in and started trying to free the little fish.
"What are you doing?" asked a voice behind her.
Jane turned around and saw a friendly old man.
"I'm trying to rescue the fish," she said.
The old man smiled. "You're a brave girl!"
Together they managed to rescue the fish, set it free back into the sea, and Jane went home a happy girl.

Once upon a time, there was a jolly man. The man loved to read. He had a new book. The book was a novel.
The jolly man read the novel every day. He read it under a big tree. The tree was by a pretty lake. The man was happy.
One day, a little bird came to the tree. The bird liked the jolly man. The man and the bird read the novel together. They were best friends.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there was a girl named Jane. Jane loved to eat olives. One day, she found an incredible big olive in the yard. She was very happy and showed it to her mom.
Jane's mom said, "Wow, that's an incredible olive! Let's make a yummy salad with it for dinner." Jane was excited and couldn't wait for dinner.
At dinner, Jane's family sat down to eat. When they tasted the salad, they were amazed. "This is so good!" said Jane's dad. "You were right, Jane. That incredible olive made the salad so tasty!" Jane smiled and was proud that her olive made everyone happy.

Once upon a time there was a little girl. One day she went for a walk in the park. Suddenly, the little girl heard someone cry for help! She rushed over to find a cat stuck up in a tree.
The girl asked the cat, "What happened?"
The cat said, "I was climbing the tree and then I got stuck!"
The girl decided to rescue the cat. She said, "I will help you!" She looked around and found a long stick. She put the stick in the tree and the cat was able to climb down.
The cat said, "Thank you for rescuing me!" The girl said, "It was my pleasure. Let's go get a pizza to celebrate!"
So they went to the pizza parlor. The girl ordered an original pizza and they both shared it. The cat was so happy, he moments of being stuck in the tree were forgotten. They shared the delicious slices, talking and laughing. They both had a fun time and knew that they would be the best of friends.
<|endoftext|>

Once upon a time there was a little boy named Jack who loved flowers. He spent his days picking them from his garden and putting them in a jar by his window. One day Jack's sister saw the flowers and wanted to play with them, but Jack said no. He wanted to keep them safe. His sister was sad and said she wanted to help. So Jack let her come into the garden and pick one flower to make into a necklace. She was so happy! 
The next day, Jack's sister wanted to go back into the garden and pick more flowers. Jack said no, because he wanted to keep his flowers safe. But his sister was stubborn and kept teasing him to let her pick more. 
Jack finally said yes, but he said she must be careful and not pick any of the important flowers. So she agreed. She picked lots of flowers and made a beautiful necklace. From then on, Jack and his sister visited the garden together to pick flowers. 
No matter how much his sister teased him, Jack always made sure to keep the important flowers safe.

Once upon a time, there was a friendly seed. This seed wanted to grow big and strong. It liked the sun and the rain. The seed was very happy.
One day, the seed started to grow. It grew up and up, and its leaves were soft. The texture of the leaves was nice. The friendly seed was now a friendly plant.
All the kids liked the friendly plant. They played near it and touched its soft leaves. The friendly plant grew bigger and bigger. It was a happy plant, and everyone loved it.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there lived a little girl named Lily. She had a blue ball that she loved very much. She played with the ball every day in her yard. 
One day, Lily's friend, Tim, came over to play. They played with the blue ball together. But Tim accidentally threw the ball too far, and it went into the big tree. Lily and Tim tried to get the ball down, but they could not reach it.
Tim felt very sorry. He said to Lily, "I promise I will find a way to get your blue ball back." They thought and thought. Then, they found a long stick. They used the stick to poke the ball out of the tree. 
Lily was so happy to have her blue ball back. She hugged Tim and said, "Thank you for keeping your promise." They played with the ball for the rest of the day, and they were very careful not to throw it too far again.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Amy. She lived in a small house with her mom and dad. One day, Amy saw her mom doing the laundry. She wanted to help, so she asked, "Mom, can I help you with the laundry?"
Her mom smiled and said, "Yes, you can help me fold the thick, warm towels." Amy was very happy to help her mom. She picked up a thick towel and tried to fold it. It was hard, but she did not give up. She tried again and again.
Finally, Amy folded the thick towel. Her mom was very proud of her. "Great job, Amy!" her mom said. Amy felt happy and proud too. She thought, "I can help my mom with the laundry and be a big girl!" From that day on, Amy always helped her mom with the laundry.
<|endoftext|>


Ben and Mia are twins. They like to play in their room. They have many toys and books and pillows. Sometimes they share, sometimes they fight.
One day, Ben finds a big, tough pillow. It is brown and furry and has a zipper. He likes it very much. He puts it on his bed and hugs it.
Mia sees the pillow and wants it too. She says, "Ben, give me the pillow. It is mine. I saw it first."
Ben says, "No, Mia. It is mine. I found it. It is very tough and soft. Go away."
Mia gets angry and tries to grab the pillow. Ben holds it tight and pushes her away. They start to yell and pull and push.
Mom hears the noise and comes to the room. She sees Ben and Mia fighting over the pillow. She says, "Stop, stop, both of you. What is going on here?"
Ben and Mia tell Mom their stories. Mom looks at the pillow and sees the zipper. She opens it and finds a tag inside. It says, "This pillow belongs to Grandma. She gave it to me when I was little. Love, Mom."
Mom says, "Oh, I see. This is a very special pillow. It was my pillow when I was a kid. Grandma made it for me. She was very good at sewing. She used tough fabric and soft stuffing. She put a zipper so I could wash it. She also put a secret pocket inside. Do you want to see what is in the pocket?"
Ben and Mia nod and stop fighting. Mom reaches inside the pocket and pulls out a small photo. It shows Mom as a little girl with Grandma. They are smiling and holding the pillow.
Mom says, "This is me and Grandma. She gave me this pillow for my birthday. She said it was a magic pillow. It could make me feel happy and safe and loved. She said I could always talk to her through the pillow. She said she would always listen and care."
Ben and Mia look at the photo and the pillow. They feel sorry for fighting. They say, "Sorry, Mom. We didn't know. Can we share the pillow?"
Mom says, "Of course, you can. The pillow has enough magic for both of you. You can take turns to hug it and talk to Grandma. She would love to hear from you. She would be proud of you for being kind and sharing."
Ben and Mia hug Mom and the pillow. They say, "Thank you, Mom. We love you and Grandma. We love the pillow too. It is very tough and soft and magic."

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. She had a doll that she loved very much. The doll was perfect to her. One day, Lily went to the park with her doll. She saw a boy named Tom with a big red ball.
Lily said, "Tom, can I play with your ball?" Tom said, "Yes, but only if you let me play with your doll." Lily did not want to, but she wanted to play with the ball. So, she let Tom hold her doll.
Lily had fun with the ball, but then she saw Tom let the doll go. The doll flew up into the sky. Lily was sad and mad. She asked Tom, "Why did you do that?" Tom said, "I wanted to see if the doll could fly."
Lily was very sad. She thought her doll was gone forever. But then, a big bird came and caught the doll in its beak. The bird flew down and gave the doll back to Lily. Lily was so happy!
From that day on, Lily and Tom were friends. They played with dolls and balls together. And they learned to never let go of things they loved.

Lily and Ben are friends. They like to play in the park. They have a new bucket and spade. They want to make a big sand castle.
They find a good spot near the slide. They start to fill the bucket with sand. They pat it down and turn it over. They make a nice tower. They smile.
But then, a big boy comes. He is mean. He kicks their tower. He laughs. He runs away.
Lily and Ben are sad. They frown. They look at their broken tower. They cry.
A nice lady sees them. She is a teacher. She comes to help. She talks to the big boy. She tells him to say sorry. She gives Lily and Ben a hug. She helps them make a new tower. She puts a flag on top. She smiles.
Lily and Ben are happy. They stop crying. They thank the lady. They play with their new tower. They have fun.

Once upon a time, there was an adorable goose. The goose loved to play outside. One sunny day, the goose found a big slide. The goose was so happy and excited to play on the slide.
The adorable goose climbed up the slide. When it was at the top, the goose looked down and felt a little scared. But the goose was brave, so it slid down the slide very fast. The goose laughed and had so much fun on the slide.
Then, something unexpected happened. The goose slid down the slide so fast that it flew up into the sky. The goose was surprised, but it found out that it could fly high and see everything below. The adorable goose loved flying and sliding, and it played all day long.

Sara loves to paint. She has many colors of paint and a big paper. She likes to make pictures of flowers, animals and rainbows. She is very happy when she paints.
One day, she sees a new boy in her class. His name is Ben. He looks sad and lonely. He does not have any paint or paper. He sits by himself and watches Sara paint.
Sara feels sorry for Ben. She is a compassionate girl. She wants to help him and make him happy. She decides to ask him a question.
"Hi, Ben. Do you want to paint with me?" Sara asks. She smiles and holds out her paint and paper.
Ben looks surprised and shy. He does not know Sara. He does not know how to paint. He shakes his head and says, "No, thank you."
Sara does not give up. She thinks of another question. She says, "Do you like flowers? I can show you how to paint a flower. It is easy and fun."
Ben looks curious and interested. He likes flowers. He nods and says, "Yes, I like flowers."
Sara is happy. She moves closer to Ben and gives him some paint and paper. She says, "Look, this is how you paint a flower. You make a circle for the center and some lines for the petals. Then you can choose any color you want."
Ben watches Sara and tries to copy her. He makes a circle and some lines. He chooses yellow and blue. He paints his flower. He smiles and says, "Look, I made a flower."
Sara looks at Ben's flower and claps her hands. She says, "Wow, you made a beautiful flower. You are a good painter. Do you want to paint more?"
Ben nods and says, "Yes, I want to paint more. Thank you, Sara. You are a nice friend."
Sara and Ben paint more flowers, animals and rainbows. They talk and laugh. They have fun. They become friends. They are happy.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. She loved to paint. Her mommy gave her a new paint set. Lily was very happy. She knew something yummy was coming.
One day, Lily painted a big cake. It was a yummy cake with pink and blue. She showed her mommy. Her mommy smiled and said, "Wait until tomorrow." Lily was excited.
The next day, Lily saw a big box. She opened it. Inside was a real yummy cake! It looked just like her paint. Her mommy replaced the paint with a real cake. Lily and her mommy laughed and ate the yummy cake. They were very happy.

Once upon a time, a little girl named Sue found a violin. She loved the violin and wanted to play it. Sue was persistent. Every day, she tried to play the violin, but it made bad sounds. Sue did not give up. She hoped to play beautiful music one day.
One day, a small bird flew into Sue's window. The bird was hurt. Sue felt sad for the bird. She played the violin for the bird, hoping to make it feel better. The bird listened to Sue's music and started to feel better. The bird began to sing along with the violin.
The bird's singing helped Sue play the violin better. Together, they made beautiful music. People came to listen to Sue and the bird. They were happy and clapped for them. The bird stayed with Sue, and they played music every day. The moral of the story is to never give up and always hope for the best.

One day, a little girl named Anna went to visit her elderly grandma. Grandma lived in a small house with a big garden. Anna liked to play in the garden and look at the flowers and the birds.
"Anna, come here and listen to me," Grandma said. "I have something to tell you."
Anna ran to Grandma and sat on her lap. She looked at Grandma's face and saw that she was smiling.
"What do you want to tell me, Grandma?" Anna asked.
"I want to tell you that I love you very much, and that you are very special to me," Grandma said. "You are my only granddaughter, and you make me very happy."
Anna hugged Grandma and said, "I love you too, Grandma. You are very special to me too. You are my only grandma, and you make me very happy."
Grandma kissed Anna and said, "You are a good girl, Anna. You always listen to me and you are very kind and polite. I have a gift for you. Do you want to see it?"
Anna nodded and said, "Yes, please. What is it?"
Grandma reached under her chair and took out a small box. She opened it and showed Anna a shiny necklace with a heart pendant.
"This is for you, Anna. It was mine when I was a little girl, and my grandma gave it to me. Now I want to give it to you, because you are my little girl. It is very old and very precious, so you have to take good care of it."
Anna gasped and said, "Wow, Grandma. It is very beautiful. Thank you so much. Can I wear it?"
"Of course, you can. Here, let me help you put it on," Grandma said. She clasped the necklace around Anna's neck and said, "There. Now you look like a princess."
Anna looked at herself in the mirror and smiled. She felt the necklace on her chest and said, "I love it, Grandma. It is mine now, and I will always keep it. It will remind me of you and your grandma."
Grandma hugged Anna and said, "I'm glad you like it, Anna. It will remind me of you too. You are my treasure, and I will always love you."
<|endoftext|>

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Daisy. Daisy was a happy child and she loved to play in the sunshine. But one day, something terrible happened.
Daisy was playing with her brother Marshall when suddenly, a strong gust of wind blew through their front yard. Daisy and Marshall were separated from each other! Daisy was so scared that she started crying.
Suddenly, Daisy's mommy came outside. She hugged Daisy and said to her in a comforting voice, "It's ok, Daisy. I will always stay by your side and make sure you are safe. From now on, don't ever let anyone separate you and your brother again."
Daisy hugged her mommy tight and nodded. Daisy and Marshall held each other's hands and went back to playing in the sunshine.
The moral of this story is that no one can ever separate us from the ones we love. Even when times get tough and scary, we can always rely on our family and friends to be with us and give us strength!

Once upon a time, in a land full of light, there were two friends named Tom and Sue. They liked to play outside all day. One day, they saw a big tree with a hole in it. They were curious and wanted to see what was inside. They decide to look inside the hole when it was not dark.
The next day, Tom and Sue went to the tree when the sun was up, and it was light outside. They looked inside the hole and saw something shiny. They were very excited and wanted to see what it was. But they had to wait, as their mom called them for lunch.
After lunch, Tom and Sue went back to the tree. It was getting dark, but they wanted to see the shiny thing. They reached inside the hole and pulled out a small box. They opened the box and found a beautiful, shiny stone. They were so happy they found the stone when it was still light outside. They ran home to show their mom the pretty stone they found. And from that day on, Tom and Sue always had a little bit of light, even when it was dark.

Once upon a time, there was a big, bossy cat named Kitty. Kitty liked to play with her shiny diamond toy. She would stare at it all day long.
One day, Kitty met a small, friendly dog named Doggy. Doggy saw the diamond toy and wanted to play with it too. Kitty didn't want to share her toy. She said, "No, it's mine!"
Doggy felt sad but he had an idea. He found a big, red ball and showed it to Kitty. Kitty stared at the red ball and thought it was fun. She said, "Let's play together!"
Kitty and Doggy played with the red ball and the diamond toy. They shared and had lots of fun. From that day on, they became the best of friends.

Once upon a time, in a big city, there was a wild dog. The dog liked to run and play all day. But the people in the city did not like the wild dog. They said, "We will not let the wild dog play here."
One day, a little girl saw the wild dog. She felt sad for the dog. She said, "I will let the wild dog play with me." The little girl and the wild dog played all day. They had so much fun.
But then, something unexpected happened. The wild dog found a lost baby bird. The wild dog and the little girl helped the baby bird find its mom. The people in the city saw this and changed their minds. They said, "The wild dog is good. We will let the wild dog play in the city." And they all lived happily ever after.

Tom and Anna are friends. They like to play with toys and share snacks. One day, they find a bottle in the park. It is shiny and has a picture of a star on it.
"Wow, look at this bottle!" Tom says. "It is so pretty. I want it."
"No, I want it!" Anna says. "It is mine. I saw it first."
They both grab the bottle and pull hard. The bottle breaks and the water inside spills out. They are both wet and sad.
"I'm sorry, Tom," Anna says. "I was not modest. I wanted the bottle too much."
"I'm sorry, Anna," Tom says. "I was not modest either. I did not trust you to share the bottle with me."
They hug and say sorry. They throw away the broken bottle and find a new toy to play with. They are friends again. They are happy.

One day, a small bird named Tim was very proud. He lived on a big mountain. Tim liked to fly high and snap little bugs with his beak.
One morning, Tim saw a big cloud near the mountain. He knew it would rain soon. Tim told his friends, "Let's find a safe place to hide." But his friends did not listen. They wanted to play and have fun.
Later, the rain came. It was heavy and the wind blew hard. Tim was safe in his hiding place. His friends were wet and cold. They wished they had listened to Tim. After the rain stopped, Tim's friends said, "You were right, Tim. We should have listened to you." Tim felt proud and happy that he could help his friends.

Once upon a time, there was a happy car. His name was Bob. Every day, he would drive along the road, taking people where they wanted to go. 
Sometimes people asked Bob questions. He would always answer them in the best way he could. 
One day, Bob was driving around the city, when he saw a perfect red car. He had never seen a car as perfect as this one before. 
Bob drove near the car and asked it a question. He wanted to know how it was so perfect. 
The car told Bob that it had been made with love and care, and that was why it looked so perfect. 
Bob was so happy to know this. He said goodbye to the perfect car and drove away knowing he could be perfect too.

Once there was a little girl called Bella. She was three years old and loved playing with her pet rabbit, Hop. One day, Bella wanted to give Hop a special treat. She had heard that giving a rabbit a rub with a powerful brush would make them feel so happy and relaxed.
So Bella took Hop to the stable and carefully started to work the powerful brush over his fur. Hop's fur was so soft and as Bella rubbed, Hop began to close his eyes and enjoy the feeling.
Bella took Hop back home and hopped out of the stable, feeling very proud of her work. She knew that she had given Hop the best treat of all and she was sure he would not forget it. From that day forward, Bella always makes sure to give Hop a powerful rub with her brush each week.

One day, Spot and his friends had a fun day at the beach. They played in the sand and got very dirty. They knew they needed to wash before going home.
Spot and his friends went to the water to wash. They splashed and played, washing the sand off their fur. After they were clean, they went home. Spot's mom was happy to see her helpful dog clean and ready for bed.

Lucy and the dog walked down the street. They saw a boy named Tom. Tom said, "Hey, that's my dog! Thank you for finding him!" Lucy smiled and said, "You're welcome, Tom. I'm happy to help."
Tom was very happy to see his pet dog. He hugged the dog and said, "I missed you so much!" Lucy smiled again and waved goodbye. She was glad that the dog found its home.

Once upon a time, there lived a very brave worm. This worm was sent on an amazing mission to find an escape. He bravely wriggled through the garden, looking for the perfect way out. 
He made his way past tall trees, over high hills and through deep rivers, but he could not find the escape he needed. Then, suddenly, he saw a tiny cave. He knew that this had to be the escape he was searching for! 
He wiggled his way inside and, sure enough, he found a way out! It was so amazing that he could hardly believe it. He happily crawled out of the cave, to freedom and safety. 
The brave little worm was very proud of his mission. He had done exactly what he was sent to do and had found the perfect escape.

Once upon a time, in a big zoo, there was a big gorilla named Gogo. Gogo was very sad and gloomy. He missed his friends who lived far away in the jungle.
One day, a little girl named Lily came to the zoo with her mom. Lily saw the sad gorilla and asked her mom why Gogo looked so gloomy. Her mom mentioned that Gogo missed his friends.
Lily thought for a moment and had an idea. She went home and drew a picture of Gogo and his friends playing together in the jungle. The next day, she came back to the zoo and showed the picture to Gogo. The gorilla smiled and felt happy again. From that day on, Gogo and Lily became best friends.

Tim saw a girl named Sue. Sue looked very sorry. She said, "That's my toy car. I lost it near the drain." Tim did not want to give the car back. He was not happy. Sue was sad too.
Sue said, "Please let me play with the car too." Tim thought for a moment. He said, "Okay, we can both play with the car." But when they played near the drain, the car fell in. Now, both Tim and Sue were very sad. They lost the toy car forever.

Tim and Max walked and found a big hole. Tim said, "Let's bury something!" They put a toy in the hole and covered it with dirt. They were happy to bury the toy.
Later, they heard the jazz man yell, "Oh no! My special jazz hat is gone!" Tim and Max went back to the hole. They dug up the toy and found the jazz hat under it! The jazz man was so happy. They all laughed and danced to the jazz music.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a toy fairy that she loved very much. One day, Lily found a big, red apple. It was so shiny and looked delicious.
Lily said to her toy fairy, "Let's eat this yummy apple!" But the fairy did not say anything because it was just a toy. So, Lily started to rub the apple to make it even shinier. As she rubbed the apple, she felt it getting warmer and warmer.
Suddenly, a real fairy appeared! The fairy said, "Lily, you should not eat that apple. It is not good for you." But Lily did not listen to the fairy. She took a big bite of the apple. It tasted delicious at first, but then her tummy started to hurt. Lily was sad and wished she had listened to the fairy.

Once upon a time, there was an incredible ant. This ant was very small, but it could do big things. It lived in a big ant hill with all its ant friends.
One day, the incredible ant wanted to finish building its home. It worked very hard, carrying little pieces of dirt in its tiny mouth. It wanted to make the ant hill even bigger and better.
The incredible ant worked all day and didn't stop. Finally, it finished the job. The ant hill was now the biggest and best home for all the ants. The other ants were very happy and they all lived together in their big, incredible home.

One day a small boy, who was just three, was walking all alone. He came across a beautiful ink bottle. He was so curious and confused, so he decided to hold the ink bottle. He held it in his hands and examined it very carefully.
As he was admiring the bottle, he noticed a tiny tag on it. He tucked it away in his pocket and continued observing the bottle. Suddenly, the bottle started to shake and shake and the ink inside it started to bubble and turn a bright purple color! The little boy was so excited!
The mysterious ink started to drip out of the bottle and onto the ground. After it was all empty, the little boy was a little confused. He looked around and noticed colorful pictures appearing on the ground. He followed the pictures until they led him to a park filled with majestic trees and lush green grass. 
The little boy was amazed! He had discovered a secret hidden ink, and it had led him to the most beautiful place he had ever seen! He was no longer confused. Instead, he was filled with joy and wonder. He held tightly to the ink bottle, and made a silent promise to come back and explore the park again.

One night, Ben and Lily wanted to see the moon. They put on their coats and shoes and went to the back door. But the door was locked. Mom and Dad had gone to bed and they did not hear them.
"Let's go to the front door," Ben said. He was brave and smart. He took Lily's hand and they walked to the other door. But the front door was locked too. Ben and Lily felt sad and scared. They wanted to see the moon, but they could not go outside.
They saw a window that was open a little bit. Ben climbed on a chair and pushed the window up. He saw the moon shining in the sky. It was big and round and bright. He smiled and said, "Look, Lily, there is the moon!"
Lily climbed on the chair too and looked at the moon. She was happy and amazed. She said, "Wow, the moon is so pretty! Can we touch it?"
Ben shook his head and said, "No, we can't touch it. It is very far away. But we can wave to it and say hello."
Ben and Lily waved to the moon and said hello. The moon seemed to wink at them and say hello back. They felt warm and cozy. They did not need to go outside. They had seen the moon from the window. They were brave and lucky. They hugged each other and went back to bed. They dreamed of the moon and the stars.

Once upon a time, there was a muffin. The muffin was very strong. He lived in a little house on a hill. One day, the muffin went for a walk in the forest.
In the forest, the muffin met a little bird. The bird said, "Hello, muffin! You are very strong. Can you help me find my friend?" The muffin said, "Yes, I can help you."
They looked and looked, and soon they found the bird's friend. The friend was very happy to see them. The muffin was glad he could help. The birds said, "Thank you, strong muffin!" And they all played together in the forest.

One day, a person named Tim went to a room with a big machine. The machine could print anything Tim wanted. Tim wanted to print a picture of a cat. He said, "Machine, print a cat for me, please."
The machine made a noise and printed a cat on a paper. Tim was very happy. He showed the cat to his friend, Jane. Jane said, "Wow, Tim! That is a nice cat. Can you print a dog for me?"
Tim went back to the room with the big machine. This time, the room was empty. Tim said, "Machine, print a dog for Jane, please." The machine made a noise again and printed a dog on a paper.
Tim gave the dog to Jane. They both were very happy with their new pictures. They said, "Thank you, machine!" And they went to play with their new cat and dog.

One day, a tall man went for a walk. He saw a little boy staring at something on the ground. The boy looked sad. The tall man walked over to the boy and asked, "Why are you sad?"
The boy said, "I lost my toy weapon. It was my favorite toy." The tall man wanted to help the boy. They looked around for the toy weapon together. 
Soon, they found the toy weapon under a big tree. The boy was very happy. He said, "Thank you, tall man!" The tall man smiled and said, "You're welcome. Have fun playing!" And they both went on their way, feeling happy.

Once upon a time, there was an attractive fisherman who lived by the lake. Every day he would take out his boat and put his fishing nets in the lake. He loved counting the fish he caught and could tell you the number of each kind of fish he caught. 
One day, he saw another fisherman near the lake. He asked the other fisherman what kind of fish he had caught. The other fisherman said he hadn't caught any. The fisherman was annoyed because the other fisherman was taking up his fishing spot. 
He said, "You're taking my spot, why don't you just leave?" The other fisherman said, "I'm not leaving until I get at least one fish!"
The fisherman thought for a moment and then told the other fisherman, "Here's a deal. I'll give you one fish, if you leave now."
The other fisherman agreed and took the fish. 
The attractive fisherman was happy to have the lake to himself again. Every day he could now go back to counting the fish he caught - it was far more enjoyable than arguing with the other fisherman!

One day, a little crocodile was near a distant river. He was very hungry. He saw a big fish in the water. The crocodile thought, "I need to catch that fish to eat."
The crocodile tried to catch the fish, but the fish was very fast. The fish said, "You can't catch me, crocodile!" The crocodile felt sad and wanted to find another way to get the fish.
Then, the crocodile saw a big rock. He had an idea. He pushed the rock into the water, making a big splash. The fish got scared and swam close to the crocodile. The crocodile opened his mouth and caught the fish. The crocodile was happy and not hungry anymore.

Finally, the square box opened! Inside, there were many colorful toys for the fish to play with. Fin and his friends had so much fun playing with the toys. They were very happy that they had found the square box. And from that day on, Fin and his friends played with the colorful toys every day.

Mommy came over and said, “Amy, do not worry. I will help you.” 
Amy smiled. Mommy showed Amy how to use the tool in a normal way. And then, Amy tried again.

It kept trying to print. The printer broke more and more. In the end, the pink square could not print anything ever again. The pink square was very sad. The moral of the story is to take care of your things and not use them too much.

Tom and Lily were friends. They liked to play in the park. One day, they saw a big jar of sugar on a bench. They wanted to taste it. They ran to the jar and opened it.
But the jar was not sugar. It was bees. The bees were angry. They flew out of the jar and stung Tom and Lily. Tom and Lily cried and ran away. They looked for help.
They saw a man with a big hat and a net. He was a beekeeper. He wanted to rescue the bees. He did not see Tom and Lily. He ran to the jar and put the net over it. He was happy. He had his bees back.
Tom and Lily were sad and hurt. They had no sugar and no help. They went home and told their moms. Their moms were angry and scared. They took Tom and Lily to the doctor. The doctor gave them medicine and bandages. He said they were lucky. Some people are allergic to bees. They could die.
Tom and Lily learned a lesson. They never touched jars of sugar again. They were not friends anymore. They were afraid of each other and of bees. They stayed in their houses and did not play in the park. The park was peaceful. But Tom and Lily were not.

Once the fan was hung up, Harry and Lucy laid down in the grass and enjoyed the cool breeze. The fan made them feel so relaxed and peaceful.
The moral of this story is that with a bit of courage and help from friends, we can make something special out of a difficult situation.

Tom had an idea. He told his mom about the kid with zero balls. His mom smiled and they went to their house. Tom took one of his balls and gave it to the kid. The kid was very happy. Once upon a time, in a small country, there lived a cat named Tom. Tom loved to play and run around. One day, Tom felt dizzy after running too fast. He lay down under a big tree to rest.
While Tom was resting, he saw a small hole in the tree. Tom was curious and decided to peek inside. He saw a tiny bird who was crying. Tom asked the bird, "Why are you sad?" The bird said, "I fell from my nest, and I can't fly back up."
Tom wanted to help the bird, so he climbed the tree with the bird on his back. When they reached the nest, the bird's family was so happy! They thanked Tom for his help. The bird's mom told Tom, "You are a good cat. Not all cats are nice to birds."
From that day on, Tom and the bird family became best friends. Tom learned that even though he was dizzy, he could still help others. The moral of the story is to always be kind and help others, even when you don't feel your best.

Sara and Ben are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they see a big tree with many red picks. The picks look nice and sweet.
"Let's take some picks, Sara!" Ben says. "They are for us!"
Sara is not sure. She sees a sign that says "Do not take the picks. They belong to Mr. Fox."
"Maybe we should not take them, Ben," Sara says. "The sign says they are not for us. Mr. Fox will be angry."
Ben does not listen. He wants the picks. He climbs the tree and takes many picks. He puts them in his bag.
"Come on, Sara, take some too!" Ben says. "Mr. Fox will not know. He is not here."
Sara is scared. She does not want to make Mr. Fox angry. But she also wants to try the picks. They look so nice and sweet. She climbs the tree and takes one pick. She bites it.
"Yum, this is good!" Sara says. "Thank you, Ben!"
But then, they hear a loud growl. They look down and see Mr. Fox. He is here. He is very angry. He sees the picks in Ben's bag and the pick in Sara's hand.
"Who took my picks?" Mr. Fox says. "You are bad children! You are thieves! Give me back my picks or I will eat you!"
Sara and Ben are very scared. They try to run away, but Mr. Fox is faster. He catches them and bites them. He eats them and his picks.
Mr. Fox is happy. He has his picks and a nice meal. Sara and Ben are not happy. They are gone. They should have listened to the sign. They should not have taken the picks. The end.

The big cat and the little cat were very happy.

One day, a boy named Max came to the park. He had a shiny new ball and a fancy bike. He said he was wealthy and his dad bought him everything he wanted. He said he was better at basketball than Lily and Sam. He said he could catch the ball in the hoop every time.
Lily and Sam did not like Max. He was mean and rude. They did not want to play with him. But Max said he wanted to play with them. He said he would let them use his ball if they could catch it in the hoop. He said he would give them his bike if they could catch it ten times in a row.
Lily and Sam thought Max was lying. They did not want his ball or his bike. They liked their own ball and their own bikes. They said they did not want to play with him. They said they wanted to play with each other.
Max got angry. He said they were silly and poor. He said he would take their ball and their bikes. He grabbed their ball and threw it at them. He tried to catch it in the hoop, but he missed. The ball bounced away and rolled down the hill.

The moral of the story is that we should not be jealous of what others have and we should always be kind to our friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named True. She had a big heart and always took care to help others. One day, she found a small, lost dog in her yard. The dog was very sad and hungry. True wanted to make the dog happy, so she gave it some food and water. This was an easy thing for her to do.
The next day, True's friend, Sam, saw the dog and wanted to take it home. But True did not want to give the dog away. She cared for the dog and wanted to keep it safe. Sam got mad and they both started to cry.
True's mom heard the crying and came to see what was wrong. She listened to both True and Sam. Then she said, "Why don't we all care for the dog together?" True and Sam liked this idea. It was an easy way to solve the problem. They all took care of the dog and became the best of friends.

Lily and Ben were playing in the garden. They liked to mix water and dirt in a big bucket. They made mud pies and cakes and pretended to eat them.
"Look, I made a chocolate cake!" Lily said, holding a round mud pie with a leaf on top.
"Yum, yum!" Ben said, pretending to bite it. "Can I have some more?"
Lily nodded and gave him another mud pie. They were having fun.
But then they saw a big bush with red berries. They wondered what they tasted like.
"Let's try them!" Ben said, running to the bush.
"No, wait!" Lily said, following him. "Mama said not to eat berries from the bush. They are bad for us."
Ben was stubborn. He did not listen to Lily. He picked a berry and put it in his mouth.
"Ow!" he cried, spitting it out. "It is sour and bitter! It hurts my tongue!"
Lily ran to him and gave him some water from the bucket. She helped him wash his mouth.
"I told you not to eat the berries!" she said. "You should listen to Mama and me."
Ben was sorry. He hugged Lily and said, "I'm sorry, Lily. You are right. The berries are bad. I will not eat them again. Can we go back to playing with the mud pies?"
Lily smiled and said, "Yes, we can. But first, let's tell Mama what happened. She will make you feel better."
They held hands and went to find Mama. They learned their lesson. They did not eat berries from the bush anymore. They only ate mud pies and cakes. They were happy.
<|endoftext|>
One day, a little girl named Lily went to the park. She saw her friend, Tim, who was wearing an orange shirt. They wanted to play a game, but they did not know which game to play.
Lily said, "I recommend we do a dance!" Tim was not sure. He did not like to dance. He felt shy. This made Lily sad.
They thought for a moment. Then, Tim said, "Okay, let's do the dance together!" They both danced and laughed. They had so much fun, and Tim was not shy anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a family. They had a daughter, who was three years old. One day, her father wanted to give her a hug, but she did not want to be touched. She backed away, her arms crossed and her face full of worry. Her father said to her, “Why don’t you want me to touch you?”
The three year old daughter was quiet for a moment. Then she said, “It’s difficult. I don’t like new things.” Her father listened carefully. He wanted to show his daughter that he understood and accepted her. So, he said, “That’s alright. You don’t have to do it if it’s difficult.”
The daughter felt better, but she was still unsure. Her father offered to make things easier for her. He said, “If you are ever feeling scared, just reach out and touch my hand. We can do things together.”
The daughter smiled. She knew now that her father was there for her. His support was helping her to feel more comfortable in new situations. From then on, anytime she felt scared or unsure, she would reach out and touch her father’s hand.
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, there was a witch who lived in a little house. She had a big, dead tree in her yard. One day, a little girl named Sue walked by the house. She saw the witch outside and said, "Hi, witch! Why is your tree dead?"
The witch said, "My tree is dead because it is too old. I want to tear it down, but I am too weak." Sue wanted to help the witch, so she said, "I will help you tear it down!"
Sue and the witch started to pull and push the tree. Suddenly, the tree began to shake. They heard a loud noise and the dead tree turned into a beautiful, big, green tree! The witch was not a mean witch, but a kind witch who had been waiting for a friend to help her.
Sue and the witch became best friends. They played and laughed under the big, green tree every day. Sue learned that the witch was not scary but nice, and they lived happily ever after.
<|endoftext|>


Sara and Ben are friends. They like to play with a big ball. They bounce the ball to each other. They laugh and have fun.
One day, Sara has a funny idea. She says to Ben, "Let's bounce the ball on the roof!" Ben thinks that sounds exciting. He says, "OK, let's try it!"
They throw the ball very high. The ball hits the roof and bounces back. They catch the ball and throw it again. They do this many times.
But then, something bad happens. The ball bounces too hard. It goes over the roof and into the street. Sara and Ben run to the edge of the roof. They look for the ball. They cannot see it.
They are sad and scared. They do not know what to do. They hear a loud honk. They see a big truck. The truck has their ball. The ball is flat.
Sara and Ben cry. They say, "We are sorry, ball. We are sorry, truck. We are sorry, roof. We are sorry, mom and dad."
They learn a lesson. They do not bounce the ball on the roof anymore. They find other ways to play with the ball. They still have fun.
<|endoftext|>


Lily and Tom were playing hide and seek in the park. Lily was the seeker and Tom was the hider. Tom ran behind a big tree and waited for Lily to find him. He was very quiet and still.
Lily looked around the park and tried to find Tom. She saw a smooth rock, a yellow flower, a red ball, but no Tom. She wondered where he was. She called out, "Tom, where are you? I can't find you!"
Tom heard Lily's voice and smiled. He thought he was very good at hiding. He decided to tease Lily a little. He whispered, "I'm here, I'm here, but you can't see me!"
Lily heard Tom's whisper and followed the sound. She walked towards the big tree and saw a part of Tom's waist sticking out from behind it. She ran to the tree and shouted, "I found you, I found you! You're not very good at hiding!"
Tom was surprised and embarrassed. He came out from behind the tree and said, "How did you find me? I was so quiet and still!"
Lily said, "You were quiet and still, but you also whispered. I heard your whisper and saw your waist. You should have hidden better!"
Tom felt silly and said, "You're right, I should have hidden better. Next time, I won't whisper or show any part of me. I'll be the best hider ever!"
Lily said, "That's good, but you should also remember to have fun. Hiding and seeking is a game, not a competition. It's okay to be found sometimes. It's more fun to play with friends than to hide from them."
Tom nodded and said, "You're right, Lily. Hiding and seeking is a game, not a competition. It's more fun to play with friends than to hide from them. I'm sorry for teasing you. Can we play again?"
Lily smiled and said, "Of course we can play again. You're my friend, Tom. And friends forgive each other. Let's play again!"
They hugged and ran to a new spot to play hide and seek again. They had fun and learned a lesson. They learned that hiding and seeking is a game, not a competition. And they learned that it's more fun to play with friends than to hide from them.
<|endoftext|>
One day, a fierce dog named Spot found a toy. The toy was called a laser. Spot did not know what the laser did. He wanted to play with it. He saw his friend, a cat named Whiskers, and asked for help.
"Whiskers, can you guess what this does?" Spot asked. Whiskers looked at the laser and shook her head. "I don't know, but let's find out," she said. They both were very curious.
Spot and Whiskers played with the laser. They pushed a button and a little red light came out. The light moved fast on the ground. Spot and Whiskers chased the light, trying to catch it. They had so much fun playing together. The laser was their new favorite toy, and they played with it every day.

Mia and mommy browsed the store and greeted everyone they came across. Mia even asked the store keeper what his name was! It felt so nice to say hello. 
When they finished shopping, Mia's mom hugged her and said, "Look at you, behaving so well! I'm very proud of you." 
Mia was so happy to have behaved so well, and she knew she would keep being kind and friendly in the store for the rest of her days.

As they walked, they saw a silly duck near the pond. The duck quacked and waddled around in a funny way. Lily and Spot laughed and clapped their hands and paws. They played with the duck, and then they walked some more.

Once upon a time, there was a small panda named Pandy. Pandy lived in a big forest with his family. One day, Pandy saw a big bird in the sky. The bird was trying to take Pandy's favorite fruit from a tree.
Pandy was sad and wanted to stop the bird. So, Pandy thought of a plan. He decided to repeat a loud sound to scare the bird away. Pandy took a deep breath and shouted, "No, bird! No, bird!" The big bird heard Pandy's loud voice and flew away.
Pandy was happy that his plan worked. He climbed the tree and picked up his favorite fruit. Pandy shared the fruit with his family and they all enjoyed it together. From that day on, whenever the bird tried to take their fruit, Pandy would repeat the loud sound and scare the bird away.

Tom and Lily were best friends. They liked to play with their scooters in the park. They had fun zooming around the trees and the flowers.
One day, they saw a new girl in the park. She had a shiny red scooter. She was very good at riding it. She could turn and twist and spin in the air. She looked graceful and happy.
Tom and Lily wanted to be friends with her. They rode their scooters to her and said hello. But the new girl was not nice. She said, "Go away. You are not good enough to play with me. Your scooters are old and boring. Mine is better and faster. You are slow and clumsy."
Tom and Lily felt sad and hurt. They did not like the new girl. They rode away from her and found a quiet spot to sit. They hugged each other and said, "We don't need her. We have each other. We are good friends. We like our scooters. They are fun and cozy. We are not slow and clumsy. We are smart and brave."
They smiled and got back on their scooters. They rode around the park again. They did not care about the new girl. They had fun zooming around the trees and the flowers. They were graceful and happy.
The moral of the story is: Be kind and friendly to others. Don't judge people by their things. Friendship is more important than having the best scooter.

The mommy asked, "Did you like that?" The baby nodded and said, "Kiss me again!" So the mommy gave her baby a slow kiss on her neck. The baby giggled with joy, and asked for more! 
The mommy gave her baby lots of slow kisses all over her neck, until she was all kissed out, and mommy tickled her to finish with a big hug.

Ben and Lily were playing in the sand. They had a big bucket and a small bucket. They filled the big bucket with sand and turned it over. They made a big hill.
"Look at our hill!" Ben said. "It is so big and strong!"
Lily nodded. She liked their hill. She wanted to make it bigger. She took the small bucket and ran to the water. She filled it with water and ran back.
"Watch this!" she said. "I will make a river on our hill!"
She poured the water on the hill. The water made a hole in the sand. The hill started to fall down.
"Oh no!" Ben said. "Our hill is breaking!"
Lily was scared. She did not mean to break their hill. She dropped the small bucket and hugged Ben.
"I'm sorry, Ben!" she said. "I did not want to scare you!"
Ben hugged her back. He was not angry. He was just sad.
"It's okay, Lily," he said. "We can make another hill. But next time, let's not use water. Water is not good for sand hills."
Lily nodded. She learned something new. She picked up the small bucket and smiled.
"Okay, Ben," she said. "Let's make another hill. But this time, let's make it with shells and stones. They are pretty and strong!"
Ben smiled too. He liked that idea. He took the big bucket and followed Lily. They went to look for shells and stones. They forgot about the broken hill. They were happy again.

Tim met a fish named Finn who lived in a pond. Finn said, "I want to see the humble flower too!" Tim told Finn, "I can show you the flower, but you must dive out of the water." Finn was scared, but he wanted to see the flower very much.
Finn took a big breath and dove out of the water. He saw the humble flower and smiled. Tim was happy that he could show his new friend the flower. They both knew that it was a special flower. From that day, Tim and Finn became best friends and loved to look at the humble flower together.

Once upon a time, there was a thin cat named Tom. Tom liked to poke things with his paw. One day, Tom went for a walk in the park.

Tom picked up the watch and took it home. He showed it to his friend, a dog named Max. Max and Tom played with the watch all day, poking it and listening to the beeps. They were very happy and had lots of fun with their new toy.

Anna and Ben were playing in the living room. They saw a big sack on the sofa. It was full of toys and books. They wanted to see what was inside.
"Can we open the sack, Mom?" Anna asked.
"Not yet, sweetie. That's for later. It's a surprise," Mom said.
Anna and Ben looked at each other. They were curious. They waited until Mom went to the kitchen. Then they tiptoed to the sofa and peeked inside the sack.
They saw a lot of things. They saw a teddy bear, a ball, a puzzle, a coloring book, and a calendar. The calendar had pictures of animals and numbers. It was weird.
"What is this?" Ben asked, holding the calendar.
"I don't know. Maybe it's a game," Anna said.
They tried to flip the pages, but they were stuck together. They pulled harder, but the calendar ripped.
"Oh no! We broke it!" Anna cried.
Mom heard the noise and came back to the living room. She saw the torn calendar and the open sack.
"What did you do?" Mom asked, looking angry.
"We're sorry, Mom. We just wanted to see the surprise," Ben said.
Mom sighed. She picked up the calendar and the sack.
"This was not a surprise for you. This was a surprise for Grandma. It's her birthday tomorrow. The calendar was a special gift. It had photos of you and your cousins. Now it's ruined," Mom said.
Anna and Ben felt bad. They did not know it was for Grandma. They loved Grandma. They wanted to make her happy.
"We're sorry, Mom. Can we fix it?" Anna asked.
Mom shook her head.
"No, honey. It's too late. You should have waited and asked me first. Now we have to find another gift for Grandma. And you have to say sorry to her too," Mom said.
Anna and Ben nodded. They learned their lesson. They hugged Mom and said they were sorry. They hoped Grandma would forgive them. They wondered what they could give her instead. Maybe a drawing or a hug. Or both.

One day, the lion went to his friend, the bird. The bird lived in a tree. The lion asked the bird, "Can I live in your tree? My house is too small." The bird said, "No, you are too big. The tree will not fit you."
The lion was sad. He walked and walked until he found a cave. The cave was big and dark. The lion thought, "This cave will fit me." He went inside and made it his new home.
The lion was happy in his new home. His friend, the bird, came to visit him. They played and had fun. The wise lion learned that it is important to find a home that fits you.

Fin said to the new fish, "Why not swim and play with me? We can have fun together in the earth pond." The new fish said, "No, I want the pond all for me. Go away!" Fin was sad, but he had an idea.
The next day, Fin brought many friends to the pond. They all swam and played together. The new fish saw how much fun they had. He thought to himself, "Maybe I should not be selfish and join them." And he did. From that day on, all the fish swam and played together in the big earth pond.

Max jumped up to get the cake, but he was too small. He tried again and again, but he could not reach it. Max started to shiver because he was sad. He really wanted that cake. He sat down and thought, "How can I get the cake?"
Just then, a little bird named Lily flew by the window. Lily saw Max and knew he needed help. She flew inside and pushed the cake off the table. The cake fell on the floor, and Max was so happy! He jumped and licked Lily to say thank you.
But then, something unexpected happened. The cake was not a real cake! It was a big, soft pillow that looked like a cake! Max and Lily laughed and laughed. They played with the pillow and had so much fun. They became best friends, and they never felt sad about the cake again.

One day, a bee named Buzzy went to find food for his hive. He flew around and saw a big tree with sweet flowers. Buzzy was very happy and thought, "This is the best place to get food for my hive!" He started to take the sweet stuff from the flowers.
As Buzzy was working, he heard a voice. He stopped and listened. It was a bird named Chirpy. Chirpy said, "Buzzy, don't take food from these flowers. If you do, something bad will happen!" But Buzzy did not listen to Chirpy. He thought, "I want to make my hive happy with this sweet food."
Buzzy took the sweet stuff back to his hive. All the bees were happy and ate the sweet food. But soon, they found out that the sweet food was spoiled. All the bees felt sick. Buzzy felt sad and remembered what Chirpy had said. He learned that it is important to listen to friends. From that day on, Buzzy always listened to his friends' advice.

The little girl told the loud person, "If you ask nicely, maybe people will give you things." The loud person thought about it and said, "Please, can I have your toy?" The little girl smiled and said, "Yes, you can play with it, but you have to give it back." The loud person learned that being nice is better than being demanding.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Brad. He was very serious, and he enjoyed eating waffles. One morning, Brad decided to make waffles for breakfast. He put the ingredients together and made a batter. He heated the waffle iron and he poured the batter inside. As he waited for the waffles to be ready, he made a big mess in the kitchen. 
When the waffle iron dinged, Brad took out the waffles and saw how messy the kitchen was. He sighed and shook his head. Then he heard his mom's voice: "Brad! Did you make a mess?" 
Brad was embarrassed and he said, "Yes, mom."
His mom smiled and said, "It's ok. Cleaning up doesn't have to be a chore. Just break it down into small steps and be patient. You can start by soaking the dishes in the sink."
So Brad followed his mom's advice and he was surprised at how easy it was. From then on, Brad was careful and patient when cleaning up messes. The moral of the story is: even if it seems impossible, you can tackle a big task if you take it one step at a time.
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, there was a little boat. The boat was very happy. It liked to float on the water all day. But sometimes, the boat was careless. It did not watch where it was going.
One day, the boat was floating near some rocks. It did not see the rocks. The boat hit the rocks and got a big hole. The boat was sad. It could not float anymore.
A little girl saw the boat. She wanted to help. She fixed the hole with some tape. The boat was happy again. It could float on the water. The little girl and her friends clapped for the boat. They were all very happy.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a boy named Tom. Tom was playing with his toy car. He loved to turn the car left and right, making it go fast. One day, Tom found a big box in his room. He was very curious and wanted to know what was inside.
Tom opened the box and saw a lot of fake gold coins. They were shiny and pretty. He picked up the coins and felt their weight. They were heavy! Tom ran to his mom and said, "Mom, look what I found! Can I keep them?"
His mom smiled and said, "Yes, Tom, you can keep them. But remember, they are not real gold, just pretend."
Tom was very happy and played with the fake gold coins all day. He even shared them with his friends. They all had fun pretending to be rich. But then, something unexpected happened. While they were playing, a real gold coin fell out of the box! Everyone was surprised and excited.
Tom and his friends learned that sometimes, even when things seem fake, there can be something real and special hidden inside. They played with the real gold coin and the fake ones, and had more fun than ever before.
