Lily liked to draw with her crayons. She drew flowers, trees, animals and people. She wanted to improve her drawings and make them look more real. She asked her mom to help her.
Mom showed Lily how to use different colors, shapes and lines. She taught her how to draw shadows, details and backgrounds. Lily learned a lot from her mom and practiced every day. She improved her drawings and was very happy.
One day, Lily went to school and saw a group of kids drawing on a big paper. They were making a picture of the park. Lily wanted to join them and show them what she learned. She asked them if she could draw with them.
But the group of kids did not want Lily to draw with them. They said she was too little and did not know how to draw well. They said they were the best drawers in the class and did not need her help. They were very mean and lazy. They did not want to improve their drawings or learn new things.
Lily felt sad and angry. She did not want to be friends with them. She decided to draw her own picture of the park on another paper. She used all the colors, shapes and lines that her mom taught her. She drew shadows, details and backgrounds. She made her picture look very real and beautiful.
When the teacher saw Lily's picture, she was very impressed. She praised Lily for her hard work and creativity. She showed Lily's picture to the whole class and asked them to learn from her. The group of kids who did not let Lily draw with them felt ashamed and sorry. They realized they were wrong and lazy. They apologized to Lily and asked her to teach them how to improve their drawings. Lily forgave them and agreed to help them. She made new friends and had fun drawing with them.

Once upon a time, there was a little ant. The ant was very polite. It liked to help its friends. It liked to care for others. The ant lived in a big park with lots of grass and trees.
One sunny day, the polite ant saw a sad bee. The bee was crying. The ant wanted to care for the bee. The ant asked, "Why are you sad?" The bee said, "I lost my way home." The polite ant said, "I will help you find your home."
So, the polite ant and the sad bee walked together. They looked for the bee's home. They saw many flowers and trees. Then, they found the bee's home. The bee was very happy. The bee said, "Thank you, polite ant, for caring about me." The ant and the bee became good friends. They played together every day in the big park.

One day, a big cat went to look for food. He was very hungry. He walked and walked until he found a thick tree with lots of meat hanging from it. The cat was very happy and jumped up to get the meat.
As the cat was eating the meat, a small bird came by. The bird saw the cat eating the meat and wanted some too. The bird asked the cat, "Can I have some meat too?" The cat said, "No, this is my meat. You can't have any."
The bird was sad but had a smart idea. The bird flew up to the tree and started to sing a very pretty song. The cat liked the song and started to dance. The cat danced and danced and did not see the meat fall from the tree.
The bird quickly grabbed the meat and flew away. The cat was sad, but he learned that it is good to share with others. From that day on, the cat and the bird became friends and shared their food.

He made a shape with the clay. It was round and red, and it looked like a sun. He smiled as he looked at it and thought it was very pretty.
Barry then guessed that he could give it to somebody who was troubled like he was. He thought he would give it to his grandmother.
So, he took the clay sun and gave it to his grandmother with a big hug. His grandmother smiled and hugged him back. She said that the clay sun had made her feel much better.
Barry was happy. He had guessed that giving the clay sun to his grandmother would make her feel better, and it had worked!

Once upon a time, there was a hungry little mouse. The mouse lived in a big house. He loved to eat cheese. One day, he saw a big piece of cheese in a trap. The hungry mouse wanted to get the cheese, but he knew that the trap was not safe.
The hungry mouse had a plan. He found a long stick. He used the stick to try to get the cheese out of the trap. The mouse was very careful not to slip. He did not want to get caught in the trap. He pushed the cheese with the stick, but the cheese did not move.
Then, something unexpected happened. A big cat came into the room. The cat saw the mouse and wanted to catch him. The mouse was scared, but he had an idea. He pushed the stick one more time, and the cheese slipped out of the trap. The trap snapped shut, and the noise scared the cat away.
The hungry mouse was very happy. He got the cheese and did not get caught in the trap. The cat did not catch him either. The mouse ate the cheese and went back to his little home, safe and sound. And from that day on, the mouse was more careful about traps and always looked out for the big cat.

Tim's mom said, "Tim, don't open the box. It has something naughty inside." Tim wanted to know what was in the box, but he listened to his mom. He played with his red ball and forgot about the box for a while.
Later, Tim heard a noise from the box. He thought about what his mom said, but he couldn't help it. He opened the box. Out came a naughty cat! The cat ran around the room and knocked over Tim's toys. Tim was sad and scared. He said, "Mom, help!" Tim's mom came and caught the naughty cat. She said, "See, Tim? I told you not to open the box." Tim learned to listen to his mom and never opened the box again.

As Sam climbed higher, he slipped on a rock and fell down the hill. He got hurt and cried. Tom ran to help Sam, but it was too late. Sam was hurt and they could not play anymore. From that day, Tom learned not to dare his friends to do dangerous things.

Kitty saw Buddy and said, "Buddy, let's play a game! Close your eyes and count to ten." Buddy closed his eyes and started counting. Kitty ran away very quick to hide. She found a big box to hide in.
When Buddy finished counting, he looked for Kitty. He looked under the table, behind the door, and in the yard. Buddy found the big box and opened it. "Surprise!" yelled Kitty. Buddy laughed and said, "You got me, Kitty! That was a fun game!" They played together all day, happy with their big surprise.

One day, Billy the 3 year old was walking in the park with his mum. Suddenly, he heard a loud noise coming from the bushes.
Billy: “Mummy, what was that noise?”
Mummy: “Shhh, be quiet and look.”
Billy looked carefully and he saw a kangaroo trembling in the corner. The kangaroo was very quiet.
Mummy: “That kangaroo looks scared. It must have been a dog barking. Let’s help it.”
Billy and Mummy slowly began to move closer to the kangaroo. They offered it some food and talked to it in a gentle voice. The kangaroo stopped trembling and felt safe again. Billy smiled and was happy to help the kangaroo.
Mummy: “Well done, Billy! You did a very good thing today.”

Once upon a time, there was a gentle cat named Tom. Tom had a red cap. He wore it every day. He loved his cap a lot.
One day, Tom went to complete a puzzle with his friend, Sam. Sam was a dog. While they played, a bird flew by and took Tom's cap. Tom and Sam were very surprised.
Tom and Sam looked for the cap. They found the bird. The bird was sad. It had no hat. Tom did something unexpected. He gave the bird his cap. Now, they were all happy friends.

Lily liked to play in the field with her red ball. She liked to throw it high and catch it, or roll it on the grass. Sometimes she saw animals in the field, like birds and rabbits. But she never saw a cow.
One day, she heard a loud moo from behind a big tree. She wondered what it was. She ran to the tree and looked around. She saw a big, white cow. It had black spots and a long tail. It looked at her with big eyes and mooed again.
Lily was not afraid. She smiled and said hello to the cow. She wanted to play with it. She threw her red ball to the cow and said, "Catch!" The cow did not catch the ball. It did not know how to play. It just watched the ball bounce on the ground and roll away.
Lily ran after the ball and picked it up. She tried again. She threw the ball to the cow and said, "Catch!" The cow did not catch the ball. It did not want to play. It just ate some grass and flicked its tail.
Lily was sad. She wanted the cow to be her friend. She walked to the cow and gave it a hug. She said, "Please play with me. You are a nice cow." The cow did not hug her back. It did not like hugs. It just mooed and pushed her away.
Lily was very sad. She cried and ran back to the tree. She sat under the shade and hugged her red ball. She wished the cow would appear and play with her. But the cow did not appear. It stayed in the field and chewed its cud. Lily felt lonely and bored. She missed her mom and dad. She wanted to go home.

Tom is a big horse who lives on a farm. He likes to eat hay and run in the field. He has many friends, like the cows, the sheep and the dog.
One day, Tom sees a big pile of hay in the barn. He is very hungry and wants to eat some. He walks to the barn and starts to nibble on the hay. It is soft and sweet and makes him happy.
But then he hears a loud noise. It is the farmer, who is angry. He says, "Tom, stop! That is not your hay! That is for the winter! Go back to the field, now!"
Tom is scared and runs away from the barn. He does not want to make the farmer mad. He goes back to the field and finds his friends. They are playing in the sun. The sky is clear and blue and there are no clouds.
Tom joins them and forgets about the hay. He is happy again. He likes to play and run and be with his friends. He thinks, "Maybe I will eat some hay later, when the farmer is not there."

He grabbed all of his blocks, and started stacking them up. As he worked, it became bigger and bigger. Before he knew it, he had made a seat for a mole!
He was so proud of his creation, but when he went to look for a mole to sit on it, he couldn't find one anywhere. He looked everywhere - he peeked under logs and rocks, but he had no luck.
Little Jake was sad, but then he remembered that he could always build something else creative with his blocks! With a smile, he began to work. It was going to be fun!

One day, a boy named Tom went to the park. He saw a big tree with red apples on it. He wanted to eat one. Tom tried to reach the apples, but they were too high. He looked around and found a long stick. Tom thought, "I can use this stick to get an apple!"
Tom tried to hit the apples with the stick. He hit one apple, and it started to drop. But, a girl named Sue saw the apple fall. She ran to catch it. Tom saw Sue and shouted, "Hey, that's my apple!" Sue looked at Tom and said, "But I caught it!" They both wanted the apple, but there was only one.
Tom and Sue did not know what to do. They sat under the tree, looking at the open sky. They saw birds flying and clouds moving. Suddenly, they had an idea. They decided to share the apple. Tom and Sue smiled at each other, happy with their plan. They took turns taking bites from the apple, enjoying it together.

Once upon a time, a little boy named Tom wanted to visit his friend, Ann. Tom was very tired, but he still wanted to go. Ann lived near a big pepper farm. Tom loved pepper and wanted to see the farm.
Tom walked and walked to Ann's house. He felt more tired with each step. When he got to the pepper farm, he saw a big red pepper. Tom wanted to take the pepper home, but he knew it was not his.
Tom thought about it and took the pepper anyway. He was so tired that he fell asleep on the way back. Tom never made it to Ann's house. Now, he was lost and scared.
The moral of the story is to not take things that are not yours and always listen to your body when it is tired.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named John. John was a very intelligent boy. He lived with his mom, who loved him very much.
One day, John was playing outside when he saw a bag of candy on the ground. He reached out to grab it and his mother saw him.
John's mom said, "John, no! You know it's not right to take things that don't belong to you. You must not take the bag."
John apologized and said he was sorry and he wouldn't do it again. But his mom said he needed to be punished and he should go to his room.
So John went to his room, feeling very sad. But then his mom came in and told him that she still loved him and that she wasn't really punishing him, she just wanted him to be an intelligent boy who knew not to take things that didn't belong to him. 
John understood, and from that day forward he never took anything that wasn't his. He was always very careful to be an intelligent and honest boy. 
The end.
<|endoftext|>

Jack was an ancient explorer. He was trying to find something magical. One hot day, he was walking around balance carefully. Suddenly, he saw a huge old tree. Jack looked closely and saw something shiny at the bottom of the tree. He went closer and found a mysterious ancient gold coin!
Jack took a deep breath. He knew it was important to keep his balance while climbing down the tree. He slowly made his way towards the coin. As soon as he touched it, he heard a small voice.
"Welcome, curious explorer," it said. Jack looked around but didn't see anyone.
"Who said that? Show yourself," he said.
A small fairy appeared. Jack was surprised.
"I am the guardian of this coin," the fairy said. "I can grant you a wish, but only if you can keep your balance and not fall from the tree."
Jack was excited. He held his balance and the fairy granted him three wishes. Jack made the best use of his wishes and continued his journey. He will always remember that hot day when he found the ancient coin.
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, there was a little frog named Tim. Tim was a very selfish frog. He loved to jump and play all day, but he never wanted to share his fun with others.
One sunny day, Tim was jumping around when he saw a big clock. The clock had a big minute hand. Tim thought it would be fun to jump on the minute hand and ride it. So, he jumped on the minute hand and went round and round. He was having a lot of fun, but he still didn't want to share with others.
Suddenly, something unexpected happened! The minute hand broke and Tim fell down. He was scared and sad. Then, a kind squirrel came to help him. The squirrel fixed the clock and made it as good as new. Tim learned that sharing and being kind to others was important. From that day on, Tim was not selfish anymore. He shared his fun with all his friends and they all played happily together.
<|endoftext|>


Sara and Ben were playing in the garden. They liked to dig holes and look for bugs and worms. One day, they found something unusual in the dirt. It was a small, furry animal with a long nose and tiny eyes. It was a mole.
"Look, Ben, a mole!" Sara whispered. She was afraid to scare it away.
"Wow, Sara, it's so cute!" Ben whispered back. He wanted to touch it.
They moved closer to the mole, very slowly and quietly. The mole did not see them. It was busy digging and sniffing. Sara and Ben reached out their hands and gently stroked its fur. The mole felt soft and warm.
The mole stopped digging and sniffing. It sensed something on its back. It turned around and saw Sara and Ben. It was surprised and scared. It squeaked and ran away, back into its hole.
Sara and Ben were sad. They wanted to play with the mole. They waited for it to come back, but it did not.
"Maybe it's shy," Sara said.
"Maybe it's hungry," Ben said.
They decided to leave some food for the mole near its hole. They found some bread, cheese, and carrots in the kitchen. They broke them into small pieces and put them on a plate. They carried the plate to the garden and placed it next to the mole's hole.
"Here, mole, we brought you some food," Sara whispered. "We are sorry we scared you. We just wanted to be your friends."
They hoped the mole would hear them and come out. They sat down and waited. They did not know if the mole would ever come back, but they hoped it would. They liked the mole. It was unusual and cute.
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, there was a stubborn little boy named Tim. Tim loved to run and play all day long. One day, while playing, Tim hurt his toe. He felt very bad and began to cry.
Tim's mom saw him cry and asked what was wrong. Tim told her about his hurt toe. His mom said, "Oh, you have suffered a little pain, but don't worry, it will get better soon."
Tim was still stubborn and did not want to stop playing, even with his hurt toe. His mom gave him a big hug and told him to be careful. Tim smiled and went back to playing, but he made sure not to hurt his toe again. And soon, his toe felt all better.
<|endoftext|>


Lily and Max were playing in the park. They liked to climb the trees and swing on the ropes. They saw a big tree with a red label on it. The label said: "Do not climb. Danger."
"Look, Max, a big tree!" Lily said. "Let's climb it!"
"No, Lily, we can't," Max said. "The label says no. It is danger."
Lily made a face. She was not scared. She wanted to have fun. She said: "I dare you, Max. I dare you to climb the big tree with me. It is not danger. It is fun."
Max looked at the big tree. It was very wide and tall. He saw some birds and squirrels on the branches. He wanted to see them closer. But he also remembered the label. He was not sure what to do.
"Lily, I don't know," Max said. "Maybe we should listen to the label. Maybe the tree is sick or weak. Maybe it can fall or break."
Lily shook her head. She was not listening to Max. She was listening to her own voice. She said: "Come on, Max. Don't be a baby. I dare you. I dare you to climb the big tree with me. Or are you scared?"
Max felt a warm feeling in his chest. He did not like to be called a baby. He did not like to be scared. He wanted to show Lily that he was brave and strong. He said: "OK, Lily. I dare you too. I dare you to climb the big tree with me. Let's go!"
Lily and Max ran to the big tree. They grabbed the ropes and started to climb. They did not see the man who was coming to the park. He was the one who put the label on the tree. He was the one who knew that the tree was old and rotten. He was the one who shouted: "Stop! Stop! Get down from there! It is danger!"

Once upon a time, there was a camp with many friends. They were all honest and kind. They liked to play and have fun together. The camp was a happy place.
One day, a new friend came to the camp. He was very shy. The other friends wanted to unite and help him feel welcome. They all played together and had a lot of fun.
In the end, the new friend was happy at the camp. They all had a great time. The honest friends had united to make the new friend feel loved. And they all lived happily ever after.

Sam and Ben are brothers. They like to play outside with their ball. But today it is very hot and sunny. Sam and Ben feel uncomfortable. They are thirsty and sweaty.
"Can we go inside, Sam?" Ben asks. "I want some water and a snack."
Sam nods. He is also tired of the heat. He picks up the ball and walks to the house. But when they get to the door, they see their mom.
"Hi, boys," mom says. "Did you have fun outside?"
"Yes, mom," Sam and Ben say.
"Good. But before you go inside, I have something to remind you. You need to do your exercise. Remember what the doctor said? You have to move your bodies every day to be healthy and strong."
Sam and Ben groan. They don't want to do exercise. They want to rest and cool down.
"Please, mom," Ben says. "Can we do it later? It's too hot now."
Mom shakes her head. She smiles. "No, boys. You have to do it now. It won't take long. And I have a surprise for you. If you do your exercise, you can have some ice cream afterwards. How does that sound?"
Sam and Ben perk up. They love ice cream. They look at each other. Maybe exercise is not so bad after all.
"Okay, mom," Sam says. "What do we have to do?"
Mom shows them some simple exercises. They have to jump, run, stretch, and bend. Sam and Ben follow mom. They feel their hearts beat faster and their muscles work. They also feel more happy and energetic.
"Good job, boys," mom says. "You did your exercise. I'm proud of you. Now you can go inside and have some ice cream. You earned it."
Sam and Ben cheer. They thank mom and run inside. They enjoy their ice cream. They feel good. They are glad they did their exercise. They decide to do it again tomorrow.

Tom wanted to see the magic place, so he asked Buddy to lead him there. They walked through the woods, holding hands. They saw birds, flowers, and big trees. Tom was very happy and excited to find the magic place.
Finally, they found the magic place. It was a big, beautiful pond with lots of pretty fish. The fish could change color and sing songs. Tom and Buddy played with the fish all day. They had so much fun in the magic place. And from that day on, Tom knew that his thoughtful toy, Buddy, would always lead him to wonderful adventures.

Lily and Ben were at the beach with their mom and dad. They had a lot of fun playing in the sand, splashing in the water, and looking for shells. They saw many fish, crabs, and seagulls, but they wanted to see a whale.
"Mom, can we see a whale?" Lily asked.
"Maybe, if we are lucky," mom said. "But whales are very big and live far away in the deep sea. We have to be quiet and patient."
Lily and Ben nodded and sat on a big rock. They looked at the blue water and waited for a whale. They waited and waited, but they did not see a whale. They started to feel tired and bored.
"Can we nap?" Ben asked.
"Sure, you can nap," dad said. "But don't nap on the rock. It is hard and uncomfortable. Nap on the blanket. It is soft and cozy."
Lily and Ben agreed and went to the blanket. They lay down and closed their eyes. They heard the waves and the wind. They felt the sun and the breeze. They fell asleep and had sweet dreams.
While they were napping, a whale came out of the water. It was very big and beautiful. It spouted water and made a loud noise. It waved its tail and jumped in the air. It saw Lily and Ben sleeping on the blanket. It smiled and winked at them. It said hello and goodbye. Then it swam away.
Lily and Ben did not see the whale. They missed it. But the whale saw them. And it remembered them.

They walked around the town asking people if they knew the man in the picture. Finally, they found the man at the park with his dog. Tim gave the wallet back to the man. The man was very happy and thanked Tim and his mom. From that day, Tim and the man became good friends.

Once there was a little girl named Mary. Mary liked to bounce. She bounced in the living room, on the porch and even in the garden. But what Mary liked to bounce on the most were her trampoline and her bed.
One day, Mary decided to have a bouncing adventure. She put on her uniform and smiled because it was so healthy looking. She bounced out the door and up the sidewalk. The wind made her feel so light, like she could just bounce away! 
Mary bounced to the park and discovered a new trampoline there. It was so much bigger than hers! Mary pumped her legs and bounced higher than ever before. She could almost touch the sky!
When she was finally finished bouncing, Mary was very tired but very happy. She slowly walked back home thinking about how lovely healthy bouncing was. From then on, Mary made sure to bounce as much as she could to help keep her body strong and healthy.

Anna and Ben are twins. They like to play together. Today is their birthday. They receive a big present from Mom and Dad. It is a big box with a picture of a beach on it.
"What is it?" Anna asks.
"Let's open it and see," Ben says.
They rip the paper and open the box. Inside, they find two buckets, two shovels, two hats, and two towels. They also find a note from Mom and Dad.
"Happy birthday, Anna and Ben! We are taking you to the beach today. Have fun!"
Anna and Ben are very happy. They hug Mom and Dad and say thank you. They put on their hats and grab their buckets and shovels. They are ready to go to the beach.
At the beach, Anna and Ben have a lot of fun. They make sand castles, dig holes, and collect shells. They splash in the water and chase the waves. They see a funny crab that walks sideways. They laugh and try to copy it.
But then, they have a problem. They both want the same shell. It is big and shiny and has many colors.
"I saw it first!" Anna says.
"No, I did!" Ben says.
They both pull on the shell. They start to fight.
"Stop it, you two!" Mom says. "You have to share. There are plenty of shells on the beach. Why don't you trade some shells with each other?"
Anna and Ben think about it. They don't want to fight. They want to have fun. They look at their buckets and see that they have many different shells. They decide to trade some shells with each other. They find some shells that they like and give them to each other.
"Here, you can have this one. It is pink and smooth," Anna says.
"Thank you. And you can have this one. It is spiky and has stripes," Ben says.
They smile and hug. They are happy again. They say sorry to each other and to Mom. They go back to playing on the beach. They have a wonderful birthday.

Anna and Ben are friends. They like to play outside in the park. But today it is cold and windy. Anna's mom says they need to wear coats.
"Anna, put on your coat. It is cold outside," mom says.
"But mom, I don't like this coat. It is boring and gray. I want a different coat," Anna says.
"Sorry, Anna. This is the only coat you have. It is warm and soft. You can wear a scarf or a hat to make it more interesting," mom says.
Anna is not happy. She wants a coat like Ben's. Ben's coat is red and blue and has a big star on the back. It is interesting and fun.
Anna and Ben go to the park. They see a slide, a swing, and a sandbox. They run to the slide. Ben goes first. He slides down fast and laughs.
"Your turn, Anna," Ben says.
Anna goes to the slide. She slides down slowly and does not laugh. She is still sad about her coat.
"Anna, what is wrong? Why are you not having fun?" Ben asks.
"I don't like my coat. It is boring and gray. I like your coat. It is interesting and fun. Can I have your coat?" Anna asks.
Ben is surprised. He likes his coat. He does not want to give it to Anna.
"No, Anna. This is my coat. My grandma gave it to me. It is special to me. You can't have it," Ben says.
Anna is angry. She wants Ben's coat. She tries to grab it from him.
"Give me your coat, Ben. I want it. It is not fair," Anna says.
Ben pulls away. He does not want to fight with Anna. He is sad that she is not his friend anymore.
"Anna, stop it. You can't take my coat. It is mine. You have your own coat. It is warm and soft. You should be happy with what you have," Ben says.
Anna and Ben start to cry. They are both unhappy. They do not play anymore. They sit on the bench and look at the ground.
Mom sees them. She is worried. She goes to them.
"Anna, Ben, what is wrong? Why are you crying? Why are you not playing?" mom asks.
Anna and Ben tell mom what happened. They tell her about the coats and the slide and the fight.
Mom listens. She hugs them. She is sorry that they are unhappy. She has an idea.
"Anna, Ben, I have an idea. Why don't you swap coats for a while? You can try each other's coats and see how they feel. Maybe you will like them. Maybe you will learn something new. Maybe you will be friends again," mom says.
Anna and Ben look at each other. They are curious. They are willing to try. They swap coats. Anna puts on Ben's coat. Ben puts on Anna's coat.
They feel different. They look different. They smile.
"Wow, Anna, your coat is warm and soft. It feels nice. And it is not boring. It is gray like the sky. It is calm and quiet," Ben says.
"Wow, Ben, your coat is interesting and fun. It is bright and colorful. It has a big star on the back. It is brave and bold," Anna says.
They look at each other. They see each other differently. They like each other's coats. They like each other.
They hug. They say sorry. They are friends again.
They run to the swing. They swing high and low. They laugh.
They are happy.

Once there was a wise old owl who lived in a tree. Every season the owl would invite the birds of the forest to a gathering. 
The birds were always excited to receive an invitation and would fly to the tree where the owl lived.
At the gathering the owl would tell stories of the forest and share wisdom. All of the birds would listen carefully, soaking up the owl's words. 
One day, a young owl asked the wise owl why they gathered every season. 
The wise owl smiled and said, "We gather to show that we are connected, even when we may be different. To remind us how much we can learn from each other. That is why we invite each other to come together."

Tim and Sam were friends. They liked to play with toys. One day, they found a big box. They wanted to make a jungle with the box.
They put some green paper on the box. They put some animals inside the box. They put some sticks and leaves on the box. They said, "Look, we made a jungle!"
They took turns to be the animals. Tim was a lion. He roared and jumped. Sam was a monkey. He climbed and swung. They had fun.
But then, Tim saw a big spider on the box. He was scared. He said, "Sam, there is a spider on the box! It is big and hairy!"
Sam looked at the spider. He was not scared. He said, "It is just a spider. It is not real. It is a toy. I put it there to make the jungle more fun."
He reached out to touch the spider. But the spider was not a toy. It was real. It bit Sam on his hand. Sam screamed and dropped the spider. He cried and ran to his mom.
Tim was sorry. He said, "I did not know it was a real spider. I thought it was a toy too. I am sorry, Sam."
But Sam was angry. He said, "You are a bad friend. You put a spider on the box. You hurt me. I do not want to play with you anymore."
He went to his room and slammed the door. Tim was sad. He lost his friend. He wished he never found the box. He wished he never made the jungle.

Tim liked his hat very much. It was red and had a big star on it. He wore it every day when he went to play outside. He felt happy and proud with his hat.
One day, he met a big boy who was mean. The big boy saw Tim's hat and wanted it. He ran to Tim and grabbed his hat. He said, "This is my hat now. You have a baby hat. Go away!"
Tim was scared and sad. He tried to get his hat back, but the big boy was too strong. He pushed Tim to the ground and ran away with his hat. He laughed and said, "Ha ha, I have a cool hat. You have nothing!"
Tim cried and cried. He felt lonely and hurt. He wanted his hat back. He wanted his mom. He wanted a friend.
Then, he saw a girl who was nice. She saw Tim crying and came to him. She said, "What's wrong? Why are you crying?"
Tim told her what happened. He said, "The big boy took my hat. He was mean. He tore my hat. Look!" He showed her a piece of his hat that he still had.
The girl felt sorry for Tim. She said, "That's not fair. That's not nice. He should give your hat back. Do you want to play with me? I have a hat too. It's yellow and has a flower on it. We can share our hats."
Tim smiled and nodded. He said, "Yes, please. I want to play with you. You are nice. You are my friend."
The girl smiled and gave him her hat. She said, "Here, you can wear my hat. It's pretty and warm. We can play together. We can have fun."
Tim put on her hat and felt happy. He said, "Thank you. Your hat is pretty and warm. You are my friend. We can play together. We can have fun."
They held hands and ran to the swings. They laughed and played. They forgot about the big boy and his hat. They were not lonely anymore. They were happy.

"Would you like my cane?" the old man asked.
Grace was so excited that she nodded her head, jumping up and down.
"Thank you," she said happily.
The old man smiled and handed her the cane. Grace felt so lucky that she clasped it tightly with both hands.
Every time Grace visited the park, she took her cane with her. No matter what, it always made her feel cheerful.

Once upon a time, in a small forest, there was a little bird named Billy. Billy was sad because it was a gloomy day. The sky was gray, and the trees were dark. Billy did not want to fly or play.
Billy saw a squirrel named Sally. Sally was looking for food. She found a twig on the ground. Sally said, "Hello, Billy! I found a twig for my home. Let's play together!" But Billy was too sad to play. He told Sally, "I don't want to play. It's a gloomy day."
Sally had an idea. She told Billy, "Let's kneel down and look for more twigs for my home. When we help each other, we can make the gloomy day better!" Billy thought about it and agreed. They kneeled down and looked for twigs together.
As they helped each other, the day didn't seem so gloomy anymore. They laughed and played while they worked. Soon, the sun came out, and the forest was bright again. Billy and Sally learned that when they help each other, even a gloomy day can be fun.
The moral of the story is that helping others can make both you and them feel better, even on a gloomy day.

"Hi Tom!" said Lucy. "Want to swing with me?"
"No, I want to play sport with my ball," said Tom.
Lucy stopped swinging and went to play sport with Tom. They had a lot of fun together. They played until the sun went down and it was time to go home.

Anna and Ben are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they see a big star in the sky. Anna says, "Look, Ben, a star! I want to make a wish."
Ben says, "What do you wish for, Anna?"
Anna thinks for a moment. She says, "I wish I could become a princess. Then I could wear a pretty dress and a crown and live in a castle."
Ben says, "That sounds fun, Anna. But I wish I could become a superhero. Then I could fly and help people and fight bad guys."
They close their eyes and wish hard. They hope the star will hear them.
But nothing happens. They open their eyes and see that they are still in the park. They are still Anna and Ben. They feel sad.
Anna says, "Maybe the star did not hear us. Maybe our wishes are too big."
Ben says, "Maybe we should wish for something else. Something that we can do now."
Anna says, "Like what, Ben?"
Ben says, "Like playing on the swings. Or having a snack. Or giving each other a hug."
Anna smiles. She says, "That sounds good, Ben. I like those things. And I like you."
Ben smiles too. He says, "I like you too, Anna. You are my friend."
They run to the swings and play. They share a snack and a hug. They forget about their wishes. They are happy.
<|endoftext|>


Ben and Mia were twins who liked to play with their toy trains. They had many engines of different colors and sizes, and they made tracks on the floor. Sometimes they pretended to mail letters and packages to each other with their trains.
One day, they had a big fight over who could use the red engine. It was their favorite engine, because it was fast and shiny. They both wanted to mail a letter to their grandma with the red engine, and they did not want to share.
"Give me the red engine, it's mine!" Ben shouted.
"No, it's mine, I saw it first!" Mia yelled.
They pulled and pushed the red engine, and it broke in half. They both started to cry.
Mom heard the noise and came to see what was wrong. She saw the broken engine and the angry twins.
"What happened here?" Mom asked.
"Ben broke the red engine!" Mia said.
"Mia broke the red engine!" Ben said.
Mom shook her head. "You both broke the red engine, because you did not share. Sharing is caring, and caring is loving. Do you love each other?"
Ben and Mia nodded, but they still looked sad.
Mom hugged them and said, "I'm sorry your red engine is broken, but I have an idea. Why don't you use the blue engine and the yellow engine, and mail your letter together? That way, you can both show grandma how much you love her, and how much you love each other."
Ben and Mia liked Mom's idea. They said sorry to each other, and hugged. Then they took the blue engine and the yellow engine, and put their letter in a box. They made a track that went around the room, and took turns driving the engines. They had fun mailing their letter, and they were quiet and happy.
The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Spot. Spot was very playful and loved to run around. One day, he saw a hose lying on the ground. Spot was curious and wanted to play with it.
Spot went to his friend, the cat named Whiskers, and said, "Let's play with the hose!" Whiskers agreed, and they both started to play. They were having so much fun, but then they started to fight over who could play with the hose more.
As they fought, their friend, the wise old owl, saw them and said, "Stop fighting, my friends. It is better to share and play together than to fight over something." Spot and Whiskers listened to the owl and stopped fighting. They both played with the hose and had a great time.
The moral of the story is that it's better to share and play together than to fight over things.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there was a little bird named Bobo. Bobo was enthusiastic and loved to fly. One day, he saw a big branch on a tall tree. He wanted to sit on the branch, so he tried very hard to fly up to it.
Bobo tried and tried, but he could not reach the branch. He felt sad. Then, a big wind came and pushed Bobo up into the air. Bobo was happy because he was now close to the branch. He tried one more time to reach it.
As Bobo got closer to the branch, he saw something unexpected. There was a big, colorful butterfly sitting on the branch! Bobo was so excited to see the butterfly. They became friends and played together all day. In the end, Bobo was happy that he tried so hard to reach the branch, because he found a new friend.
<|endoftext|>
One day, a boy named Tim and his friend, Sue, were playing in the park. They saw a big tent. It was dull and old. They wanted to go inside.
Tim said, "Let's invite our friends to come play with us!" Sue agreed, and they ran to tell their friends about the tent. They all came to the park and went inside the tent together.
Inside the tent, they found many toys and games. They played together all day. The sun went down, and it was time to go home. They all said goodbye and went back to their houses. The dull tent had made their day fun and exciting.

Once upon a time, there was a brave girl named Sally. She liked to play pretend and had a little airplane made from a cardboard box. Sally was so excited to take her pretend plane for a spin!
One day, she flew to a nearby station. It was so high up in the sky that Sally was a bit scared. She nervously climbed up the ladder to the very top. From the station, Sally could see for miles!
Sally decided to try to soar around the station. She took a deep breath and pushed down on the pedals of her plane. Before she knew it, Sally was soaring high above the station!
She circled around the station a few times and felt so brave and strong. Suddenly, she heard someone calling her name. It was her dad! He had come to the station to watch Sally soar. He was so proud of her!
Sally smiled and called out, "I'm not scared anymore!" Then she climbed down the ladder and hugged her dad. She waved goodbye to the station, climbed into her pretend plane, and flew away.
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a small plastic plant in his room. He loved the plant very much and wanted it to grow big and strong. Every day, he would talk to it and give it water.
One day, Tim felt scared because he had a bad dream. He went to his plastic plant and told it about his dream. The plant seemed to listen and it made Tim feel better. As Tim talked to the plant more and more, it started to grow bigger and bigger.
Soon, the plastic plant grew so big that it touched the ceiling. Tim was very happy and not scared anymore. He learned that when you share your feelings with someone or something, it can help you feel better and grow stronger. And that was the moral of the story: talking about your feelings can help you feel better and grow stronger.
<|endoftext|>


One day, Anna and Ben went to the zoo with their mom. They saw many animals, like lions, monkeys, and elephants. They liked the elephants the most. They were big and gray, and had long noses and big ears.
"Mom, how much do the elephants weigh?" Anna asked.
"They weigh a lot, more than a car or a bus," mom said.
"Wow, they are very heavy!" Ben said.
Then they saw a sign that said "Spirit, the orange elephant". They were curious and followed the sign. They found a small elephant that was orange, not gray. He was in a separate enclosure, with some toys and a pool.
"Look, an orange elephant!" Anna said. "Why is he orange?"
The sign said that Spirit was born with a rare condition that made his skin orange. He was very friendly and playful, but he had no other elephant friends.
"Hello, Spirit!" Ben said. He waved at the orange elephant.
Spirit saw Ben and came closer. He lifted his nose and made a loud sound.
"Hello, Ben!" he said. He could talk!
Anna and Ben were surprised and happy. They talked to Spirit and learned that he liked to play with balls, splash in the water, and eat bananas. They became friends with Spirit and gave him some bananas.
"Thank you, Anna and Ben!" Spirit said. "You are very kind and nice. I like you!"
"We like you too, Spirit!" Anna and Ben said. "You are very special and fun. We don't care that you are orange. You have a big spirit!"
They hugged Spirit and said goodbye. They promised to visit him again soon. Spirit was happy. He had found new friends.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there lived a loud bird named Lou. Lou loved to sing poems all day long. His poems made everyone happy. The town was a very nice place because of Lou's songs.
One day, a big storm came to the town. The wind was so strong that it blew Lou far away. The town became very sad without Lou's poems. The people missed Lou and his happy songs.
A kind girl named Sue had an idea. She asked everyone in the town to come together and unite. They all held hands and called for Lou. Their voices were so loud that Lou heard them. With the help of their love, Lou found his way back to the town. Everyone was so happy, and Lou sang his poems louder than ever before. The town was a happy place once again.

Once upon a time there was a girl who wanted to make something yummy. She had a pear in her hand and decided to prepare it.
She started by washing it carefully, then she cut it into small pieces. 
Finally, she added a bit of sugar on top and looked at the result. It looked delicious! 
The girl was happy with her work, but she was missing something. She thought for a moment. Suddenly, she remembered somebody who had been very helpful to her before.
She asked her helper to join her so that they could enjoy the pear together. 
The helper was happy to help, of course. The two of them sat down and started eating the tasty pear.
They were so happy with the snack they had prepared together.

Once upon a time, there was a small boy who was always playing a game of hide and seek. One day, he found an old radio. He looked around it and saw that it was very deep. He asked his mom why it was so deep.
"It might be hiding something," said Mom with a smile.
The boy was excited at the thought of finding something special. He slowly opened the deep radio and found a present!
He grabbed the present and hugged it tight. "Thank you for hiding this for me," he said, grinning from ear to ear.
His mom smiled and said, "You never know what you'll find if you look deep enough!"
<|endoftext|>

Jack was very excited. He was going to the park with his scooter. As he walked through the park, he whistled a happy tune. Then, he saw a big hill. Despite feeling a little scared, Jack decided he wanted to try and ride down the hill on his scooter. But as he started down, he lost control and crashed into a bush. He was so embarrassed that he felt like he wanted to cry. 
His sister saw what happened and quickly ran over to him. She said, "It's okay, Jack. Don't be ashamed. Why don't you try again?"
Jack shook his head, smiling shyly, and said, "Okay. I'll try again." This time, he was more careful, and he went down the hill easily. He was so proud of himself that he started blowing his whistle again. His sister cheered him on, clapping her hands as he rode down. 
Jack had learned an important lesson: when something makes you afraid, it's okay to ask for help.

One day, a little boy named Tim went for a walk. Tim was very alert. He saw a zigzag path in the park. He thought it would be fun to walk on it. So, he started to walk on the zigzag path.
As he walked, he started to count his steps. "One, two, three," Tim counted. He was having a lot of fun. Suddenly, something unexpected happened. A little bird flew down and landed on the path.
The bird started to count too! "Four, five, six," said the bird. Tim was very surprised. He never knew that birds could count. They became friends and counted together. "Seven, eight, nine," they said. And they laughed and played on the zigzag path all day long.

Once upon a time, there was a fragile little bird named Billy. Billy loved to rock on the branch of a big tree. Every day, he would rock back and forth, back and forth, singing a happy song.
One day, while Billy was rocking, he saw a big cat named Tom. Tom was very hungry and wanted to eat dinner. He looked at Billy and said, "Little bird, you will be my dinner tonight!"
Billy was scared but he had an idea. He said to Tom, "If you let me go, I will find you a big, yummy dinner. I promise!" Tom thought for a moment and said, "Okay, but you better be quick!"
Billy flew away and found a big, juicy worm. He brought it back to Tom and said, "Here is your dinner, Tom! A big, yummy worm!" Tom was happy and ate the worm. He said, "Thank you, Billy. You are a good friend."
From that day on, Billy and Tom were best friends. They played together and shared their dinner every day. And Billy still loved to rock on the branch of the big tree, singing his happy song.

Ben loved to pack. He liked to pack his backpack and pretend he was going on an adventure. He would pack the same things every time: a video, a blanket, and a snack. 
One day, Ben's mom told him to pack his school bag. He didn't want to, but he did it anyway. He put his favorite video in the bag and said goodbye to his mom.
When Ben got to school, he was surprised to find out that today was video day. Everyone was so excited! They all got to watch a video.
Ben opened his bag to get his video but it felt hard! He realized he had forgotten to take it out before he left for school. Ben felt silly, but he didn't mind. He just turned to his friend and said, "Let's just watch the same video."

Tom and Lily are adventurous twins. They like to explore new places and have fun. One day, they find a big box in the garage. They wonder what is inside.
"Let's open it!" Tom says.
"Maybe it has a surprise!" Lily says.
They open the box and see many colorful things. They see hats, flags, drums, and trumpets. They are costumes and instruments for a march. Their dad used to play in a band when he was young.
"Wow, this is cool!" Tom says.
"Let's try them on!" Lily says.
They put on the hats and flags and pick up the drums and trumpets. They look like soldiers in a parade. They decide to march around the house and make some noise.
"Left, right, left, right!" Tom says.
"Boom, boom, boom!" Lily says.
They march and play and have a lot of fun. They go to the living room, the kitchen, the bedroom, and the bathroom. They make everyone laugh and clap.
But then, they hear a knock on the door. It is the mailman. He has a big envelope for their dad. He sees the twins in their costumes and smiles.
"Hello, little soldiers!" he says. "Are you having a march?"
"Yes, we are!" Tom and Lily say.
"That's very adventurous of you!" the mailman says. "Do you want to help me with something?"
"What is it?" Tom and Lily ask.
"I have to send this envelope to your dad. He is away on a trip. Do you want to write something for him?" the mailman says.
"Yes, we do!" Tom and Lily say.
They take the envelope and a pen. They write "We love you, dad!" and draw some hearts and stars. They also stick some stickers of their costumes and instruments. They give the envelope back to the mailman.
"Thank you, little soldiers!" the mailman says. "Your dad will be very happy to get this. You are very sweet and thoughtful."
"Thank you, mailman!" Tom and Lily say.
They wave goodbye to the mailman and go back to their march. They are proud and happy. They miss their dad, but they know he will be back soon. They hope he likes their surprise. They love him very much.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Sam. Sam was a good dog, but sometimes he did not behave. One day, Sam found a hidden toy under his bed. It was a small, red ball. Sam was very happy to find the ball.
Sam's mom told him that if he did not behave, she would take the ball away and put it in jail. Sam did not want his ball to go to jail, so he tried to be a good dog. He played with his ball all day and did not make any messes.
But one day, Sam forgot to behave. He broke a cup in the kitchen. His mom was sad and took the ball away. She put it in jail, which was a small box on a high shelf. Sam was very sorry and promised to behave from now on. After a few days, Sam's mom saw that he was being good, so she took the ball out of jail and gave it back to him. Sam was happy and promised to always behave.

Once upon a time there were two friends. One was big and one was small. The small one liked to look at the big one. She always wanted to do what he did. 
One day, the small one wanted to play a game. But the big one said that he already had plans. The small one felt jealous, but she decided to be nice and smiled.
The next day, the small one went to the big one’s house. She wanted to play together. The big one said he was busy but then he had an idea. He said they could both lie down in the grass and look up at the sky.
The small one was excited. She lay down on the grass and looked up at the sky. She was so happy that she started to laugh. The big one laughed too.
The small one was happy that the big one had changed his mind. She realized that he had feelings for her and thought she was special. He was no longer jealous, just happy that they were friends.

Once upon a time, in a big farm, there was a powerful bull. The bull was very big and strong. One day, the farmer decided to decorate the farm for a big party. He put up many colors and lights all around.
The powerful bull saw the pretty farm and wanted to help. He went to the farmer and said, "Can I help decorate too?" The farmer thought for a moment and said, "Yes, you can help by carrying the heavy things."
As the bull was carrying the heavy things, something unexpected happened. The powerful bull got too excited and started to run fast. He broke many things and made a big mess. The farmer was very sad.
The bad ending made the powerful bull feel sorry. He learned that he should be more careful and think before he acts. The moral of the story is to always think before you do something, even if you want to help.

One day, a little girl named Lily found a big, old box in her room. She tried to lift it, but it was too heavy. Lily called her friend, Tom, to help her.
"Tom, can you help me lift this old box?" asked Lily. Tom came and tried to help, but the box was still too heavy. They were sad because they could not open the box to see what was inside.
Then, a bird flew into the room with a feather in its beak. The bird dropped the feather on the box, and something magical happened. The box became very light! Lily and Tom lifted the box easily now. They opened it and found many fun toys inside. They played with the toys all day and thanked the bird for helping them.

One day, a boy named Tom went to the park to play. He wanted to play a sport with his friends. They liked to play ball. Tom was a bit slow, but he tried his best. His friends were kind and waited for him.
As they played, Tom saw a big dog wander into the park. The dog looked lost and sad. Tom stopped playing and went to the dog. "Hello, dog. Are you lost?" he asked. The dog wagged its tail and barked.
Tom's friends came over, and they all decided to help the dog find its home. They walked around the park, and then they saw a girl crying. She was the dog's owner! The girl was so happy to see her dog again. She thanked Tom and his friends for their help. In the end, they all played ball together, and the dog was very fast!

One morning Dezi found an old bathrobe in the closet. She showed it to her mom and said "Look what I found, Mommy!" Her mom was very surprised to find the old bathrobe. "Where did you find this?" she asked. "In the closet," Dezi said with a smile. 
Dezi and her mom put the bathrobe on and went for a walk in the park. When they arrived, Dezi spotted a rare, red ball. She quickly grabbed it and wanted to bounce it. 
Dezi's mom said, "Let's see how high we can bounce it!" Dezi got excited, and the two of them started bouncing the ball. Every time Dezi tossed the ball, it bounced higher and higher. When it got too high for Dezi, she put on the bathrobe and flew up in the sky after the ball. 
Dezi and her mom had a wonderful time playing in the park. After a while, they returned home with the red ball and Dezi's bathrobe. From then on, Dezi put on the bathrobe every time she wanted to bounce the rare, red ball.

Lily and Max are friends. They like to play and have fun. Today, they have a big dance show at school. They have been practicing for a long time. They want to do well and make their parents proud.
Before the show, Lily and Max go to the dressing room. They put on their costumes and shoes. Lily has a pink dress and a flower crown. Max has a blue shirt and a hat. They look at each other and smile. They are ready to dance.
"Are you nervous, Max?" Lily asks.
"A little bit, Lily. But I have you. We can do it together," Max says.
They hold hands and walk to the stage. They see their teacher and their classmates. They hear the music start. They have to dance now.
Lily and Max dance with their friends. They follow the steps and the rhythm. They have fun and enjoy the show. But then, something happens. Max trips on his shoelace. He falls down and bumps into Lily. Lily loses her balance and drops her flower crown. They are both clumsy and embarrassed.
They hear the audience gasp and laugh. They feel sad and ashamed. They want to hide and cry. But then, they look at each other. They see their friend's eyes and smile. They have each other. They can do it together.
They stand up and keep dancing. They pick up their hat and crown. They ignore the noise and the stares. They have fun and enjoy the show. They finish their dance and bow. They hear the audience clap and cheer. They feel happy and proud. They have done well and made their parents proud.

Once upon a time, there was a big river. It was very long, but nobody knew how long it was.
The people wanted to know how long the river was. They found a stick and decided to measure it.
So the people found a long stick and started to measure from one end of the river to the other. They counted each step carefully, and the stick got shorter and shorter. 
Finally, after a long time, they reached the other side of the river. They had measured the whole thing! 
Now the people knew how long the river was. They were very happy, and they made sure to always remember how long the river was.

Once upon a time, there was a big scary spider. It lived in a small house with a little girl named Lily. Lily did not like the spider. She thought it was too scary. But the spider insisted it was nice.
One day, Lily saw the spider in her room. She was scared and wanted it to go away. But the spider insisted it wanted to show her something. Lily was curious, so she decided to see what the spider wanted to show her.
The spider took Lily to a secret place in the house. There, she saw a big box. Lily opened the box, and inside she found a lot of toys! It turned out the spider was not scary at all. It just wanted to share the toys with Lily. From that day on, Lily and the spider became best friends.

Once upon a time, there was a pretty girl named Lily. She loved to walk in the woods near her house. One day, while walking, she found a sword on the ground. It was shiny and small, just right for her.
"Wow, a sword!" said Lily. "I can play with this!" So she picked up the sword and started to walk back to her house. On the way, she met a big dog. The dog looked at the sword and said, "Hey, that's my sword!"
Lily was surprised. "Oh, I didn't know it was yours," she said. "Here, you can have it back." The dog took the sword and smiled. "Thank you, Lily. You are very kind." And from that day on, Lily and the dog became best friends, and they played together every day.

Lily and Ben are friends. They like to play near the lake. One day, they see a kayak on the water. It is pink and shiny.
"Wow, look at that!" Lily says. "Can we go on it?"
"I don't know," Ben says. "It is not ours. Maybe someone is using it."
They watch the kayak for a while. It does not move. It is very quiet. They do not see anyone near it.
"Maybe it is a gift," Lily says. "Maybe someone left it for us to play with."
She runs to the kayak and climbs on it. Ben follows her. They sit on the kayak and hold the paddles.
"Let's go!" Lily says. "Let's explore the lake!"
They start to paddle. The kayak moves on the water. They feel happy and excited. They see fish and ducks and frogs. They see flowers on the shore. They are colorful and pretty.
"Look, Ben, look!" Lily says. "The flowers are blooming! They are opening their petals. They are saying hello to us!"
Ben looks at the flowers. He sees yellow and purple and white and pink. He smiles.
"They are beautiful," he says. "Just like you, Lily. You are my best friend."
Lily smiles back. She hugs Ben.
"You are my best friend, too," she says. "And this is the best day ever!"

One day, a little girl named Sue was playing in her room. She saw her closet was filthy. She did not like that. Sue wanted to clean it up. She started taking out her toys, clothes, and shoes. As she did this, she found a toy she thought was lost.
"Look, Mom!" Sue said, "I found my toy bear!"
Her mom came into the room and saw the mess. "Sue, why is your room so messy?" she asked.
"I want to clean my closet, but I don't know how," Sue said with a sad face.
Mom smiled and said, "I will help you." They both started to clean the closet. As they were cleaning, Sue realized that cleaning was more fun when they did it together. Soon, the closet was clean and tidy. Sue was very happy, and her mom was proud of her. They both learned that working together made hard jobs easier.

Once upon a time, there was a big ocean. In the ocean, there was a little fish named Fin. Fin was a happy fish, but he was ignorant. He did not know much about the world.
One day, Fin met an old turtle named Mr. Shell. Mr. Shell told Fin, "Little fish, you must return to your family. They are worried about you." Fin asked, "What does 'return' mean?" Mr. Shell said, "It means to go back to where you came from."
Fin swam and swam, looking for his family. He saw a big, dark shadow in the ocean. Fin was scared, but he remembered what Mr. Shell said. He knew he had to return to his family. The big, dark shadow was a whale! The whale was nice and helped Fin find his family. When Fin returned, his family was so happy. They all hugged and danced in the ocean. And from that day, Fin was not ignorant anymore, because he learned the meaning of "return" and he met a new friend, the whale.

Once upon a time, there was a man and his wife. They lived in a small house. The man and the wife loved each other very much. The wife was very fragile, like a flower. The man always took care of her.
One day, the man and the wife went to the store. They bought many things. When they got home, they had to unpack their bags. The man was very careful with the fragile things. He did not want to break them.
As they unpacked, the man and the wife found a pretty glass cup. The wife loved it very much. The man was happy to see her smile. They put the cup on a shelf to keep it safe. The man and the wife lived happily ever after.

Anna and Ben are going to the festival with Mom and Dad. They are very happy. They want to see the balloons, the clowns, and the animals. They hold hands and walk to the park.
But the park is very far. Ben is tired. He wants to ride in the stroller. He asks Mom, "Can I sit in the stroller, please?"
Mom says, "No, Ben. The stroller is for the baby. You are a big boy. You can walk."
Ben is angry. He does not want to walk. He wants to sit. He pinches Anna's arm. Anna cries, "Ow! Ben, that hurts! Stop it!"
Mom and Dad hear Anna cry. They turn around and see Ben pinching Anna. They are not happy. They scold Ben, "Ben, that is not nice. You do not pinch your sister. You say sorry to Anna."
Ben feels bad. He knows he did wrong. He says sorry to Anna. He gives her a hug. Anna forgives him. She says, "It's okay, Ben. I love you."
Mom and Dad smile. They say, "That's good, Ben and Anna. We love you too. Now let's go to the festival and have fun."
They walk to the park. They see the balloons, the clowns, and the animals. They are happy. They enjoy the festival.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim and a little girl named Sue. They were best friends who loved to play together. They both had a toy they liked a lot. Tim had a red ball, and Sue had a blue ball. One day, they decided to share their toys with each other.
As they played, they made a promise to always share and be kind to each other. They knew that sharing made them both happy. Tim and Sue played with the red and blue balls for hours, laughing and having fun.
One day, they met a deaf dog named Max. Max could not hear, but he was very good at playing with balls. Tim and Sue shared their balls with Max, and they all played together. Max was so happy to have new friends who shared with him. And Tim and Sue were happy to have a new friend too. They all promised to always play and share together.

Her mom said, "I will permit you to have a lollipop if you clean your room first." Lily was happy and started to clean her room. She put away her toys and made her bed. 
When she finished, her mom gave her a big, sweet lollipop. Lily thanked her mom and enjoyed her treat. From that day on, Lily always cleaned her room before asking for a lollipop. And she was never troubled again.

Tim walked up to Sam and said, "Can you lend me your ball, please?" Sam looked at Tim and said, "Yes, I will lend you my ball, but you have to promise to give it back when you are done." Tim was happy and promised to give the ball back.
Tim and Sam played with the ball for a long time. They had a lot of fun. When they were done playing, Tim gave the ball back to Sam, just like he promised. They both learned that sharing and keeping promises are important. And from that day on, Tim and Sam became the best of friends.

Tim's mom said, "Do you want to read about helicopters, Tim?" Tim said, "Yes, please, Mom!" So, they went to the library to find a book about helicopters. Tim and his mom read the book together. They learned many things.
Suddenly, the book started to shake. Tim and his mom were surprised. The book turned into a real helicopter! Tim and his mom got inside the helicopter. They flew high in the sky. They had a lot of fun. The hungry boy was not hungry anymore. He was happy.

Once upon a time, there was a pretty train. This train was very attractive. It was red and shiny. The train loved to go fast on the tracks.
One day, the train saw a big, mean car. The car wanted to fight the train. The train did not want to fight, but it wanted to keep going on the tracks. So, the train thought of a plan.
The train went very fast and blew its horn loud. The big, mean car got scared and ran away. The train did not have to fight, and it kept going on the tracks. The train was happy, and all the people on the train were happy too.

Sandy was a three-year-old who loved playing pretend. One day, Sandy and her parents went to the store. Inside, Sandy saw something she found very powerful - a toilet! She asked her parents if she could have it, but they told her she couldn't, and that it was too valuable to get. 
Sandy was confused and sad, but then she had an idea - she would find something else that was valuable and show her parents. She started to look around the store and eventually found something special - a shiny red diamond. 
When she showed it to her parents, they were amazed and told her that it was indeed very valuable. Both her mom and dad thanked her for finding a valuable item and rewarded her with the toilet she had asked for! 
Sandy was so excited - and now she had a brand new toilet to play with!

Once there was a little girl named Claire who loved to explore the world around her. One day she went to the beach with her family. She saw people diving in the sea and she really wanted to try it. She asked her mom if she could do it. 
At first her mom said no, but then she said that she could give it a try. So, with a lot of excitement, Claire took off her clothes and ran into the water. She waded until she was ready to take the plunge.
But then she saw a wave, bigger than a usual one, coming towards her. It was strong and it scared her. She wanted to run away but couldn't move. She was scared. 
Then suddenly, in a flash, she felt the power within her body. It was a powerful wave of courage and she was ready to dive. She plunged into the water and swam with confidence. She felt very proud of herself for overcoming her fear. 
=======================
At the end of the day, Claire emerged from the water with a big smile on her face, feeling very happy and proud of herself. She had conquered her fear and achieved something she had never done before.

Once upon a time, in a big city, there was a subway. The subway was very good and fast. It helped people go from one place to another.
One day, it started to rain. The rain was very heavy. People were wet and cold. They wanted to go home. So, they went to the subway.
The good subway was warm and dry. People were happy inside. The rain did not come in. The subway took them home. They were safe and dry. And everyone lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, in a pretty little park, there was a big pond. A duck named Dolly lived in the pond. She loved to splash and play in the water all day long. The sun was shining, and the water was nice and warm.
One day, Dolly saw a ball near the pond. She wanted to play with it. She swam over and gave it a big splash with her wing. The ball went up in the air and started to roll away. Dolly chased after it, making sure not to let it pass her.
As Dolly played with the ball, a little girl named Lily came by. She saw Dolly having fun and wanted to join in. Lily picked up the ball and threw it towards the pond. Dolly splashed it again, and they both laughed. They played together until the sun went down, and they became the best of friends.

Once upon a time, there were two toys, a bear and a cat. They were very different and had never played together. 
One day, a ghost appeared in the playroom. It was scary, almost like it was from another world! 
The ghost said to the toys, "Join forces, unite and become friends!" The bear and the cat were scared at first, but when the ghost bestowed them with a sour candy, they knew it meant no harm. 
The bear and the cat exchanged glances, and then smiled at one another. Together, they jumped up and down and made a deal: they agreed to be friends forever. 
The ghost smiled, happy that it was able to unite the toys! 
The bear and the cat enjoyed their new friendship and sweet treats - they cheered and laughed with joy! And they all lived happily ever after.
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, there was a cold cabin in the woods. A bear lived in the cabin. The bear was big and brown. He liked to use a warm blanket to stay warm. One day, the bear lost his blanket. He looked everywhere, but he could not find it.
The bear was sad and cold. He walked around the woods to find a new blanket. He saw a big tree with many leaves. The bear thought, "Maybe I can use the leaves to make a new warm blanket." So, the bear took many leaves from the tree. 
The bear went back to his cabin with the leaves. He used the leaves to make a new warm blanket. The bear was happy and warm again. He learned that he could use things from the woods to stay warm. From that day on, the bear was never cold in his cabin again.

Once upon a time, there was a barber named Tom. Tom was very serious about his job. He loved to make people's hair look nice.
One day, Tom wanted to drive his car to the park. He got in his car and drove down the street. The sun was shining, and the birds were singing.
At the park, Tom saw a little boy with messy hair. He asked the boy if he wanted a haircut. The boy said yes, and Tom made his hair look nice. The boy was so happy, and Tom felt good about helping him. And they all lived happily ever after.

Frank was at the park with his parents. His dad was pushing a swing and his mom was talking to a neighbour. Frank was so happy and started to dance. He was twirling around and singing. Suddenly, Frank heard a snap. He stopped dancing and looked around. He saw an ugly creature standing next to him. "Boo!" it shouted.
Frank screamed and ran away. The creature ran after him. Frank's parents called out his name, but Frank didn't stop. He ran and ran until he couldn't run anymore. He tripped and fell. When he looked back, the ugly creature was right behind him. "Boo!" it shouted again.
Frank was so scared that he flew up into the sky and flew away. His parents never saw him again.

Once upon a time, a little girl named Sally was playing in her room. She had a toy box full of wonders. She loved her toys so much. One day, she saw a new toy in the box. It was a small, red ball. Sally was ready to play with it.
Sally's big brother, Tom, came into the room. He saw the red ball in Sally's hands. He wanted to play with it too. Tom said, "Give me the ball!" He was demanding. Sally did not want to give the ball to Tom. She wanted to play with it by herself.
Sally and Tom started to argue. Their mom heard the noise and came into the room. She saw the two children fighting over the red ball. Mom said, "You must learn to share the ball." She took the ball and gave it back to Sally. "Now, take turns playing with the ball," Mom said. Sally and Tom started to play together. They had fun and forgot about their fight. They were happy to share the wonder of the red ball.

On the way home, Tim's toy plane did not fit in his bag. Tim was sad. He tried to hold the plane, but he dropped it. The toy plane broke into pieces. Tim cried and felt sad because he could not give the toy plane to his friend, Sam.

At school, Lily's teacher, Miss Mary, wrote on the big blackboard. Mimi liked to watch Miss Mary. Mimi thought the blackboard was fun. When Miss Mary was not looking, Mimi would peek at the blackboard.
One day, Miss Mary saw Mimi peek at the blackboard. She said, "Lily, is that your cat?" Lily said, "Yes, Miss Mary. This is Mimi. She likes to peek at the blackboard." Miss Mary laughed and said, "Mimi is very adorable."
From that day on, Mimi came to school with Lily. Mimi learned to read and write just like Lily. They had lots of fun together. And they all lived happily ever after.

One day, a cat and a dog were playing in the yard. The cat said to the dog, "I hear a man is coming. He brings wine for the big party tonight." The dog was excited and wagged his tail.
At the party, the cat and dog saw the man with the wine. The man poured the wine into a big cup. The cat and dog wanted to taste the wine too. They looked at each other and smiled.
The cat and dog took a small sip of the wine. It tasted bitter! They made a funny face and shook their heads. They decided to drink water instead. At the end of the night, the cat and dog were happy they had tried the wine, but they liked water much more.

Once there was a girl who liked to put things in her room. She liked her room to be neat and organized. She kept all of her favorite things in there, and it was very special to her.
One day, she went to play at a park and she found a rock. She wanted to keep it, so she put it in her room. But it was rough, and she got a little bit of scratch.
The rock was too rough for her room. She wanted to keep it, so she decided to put it outside her house. But the next morning the rock was gone! Someone had taken it away. 
The girl was very sad that someone had taken something that was hers. She learned that even though it is not nice to take things without permission, sometimes it is even worse to keep something that doesn't belong to you. 
Moral of the story: Respect other people's things, and always remember to put back what isn't yours.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the park with his mom. They sat down to eat lunch. Tim had a sausage in his sandwich. He looked at it and said, "I think this sausage is intelligent!"
The sausage heard Tim and started to talk. "Hello, Tim!" it said. Tim was so surprised. He had never met a talking sausage before. The sausage told him, "I am an intelligent sausage, and I can answer any question you have."
Tim thought for a moment and asked, "Why is the sky blue?" The intelligent sausage told him that the sky is blue because of the way the light from the sun shines on the Earth. Tim was amazed.
They talked and laughed while they ate their lunch. Tim's mom listened to them and smiled. She was happy that her son had made a new friend. From that day on, Tim and the intelligent sausage were the best of friends, and they had many more fun days at the park.

Tim smiled and said, "Yes, it is! Do you want to look at it too?" Lucy nodded and they sat down to read the book together. They saw pictures of deep sea fish, big whales, and pretty shells. Lucy and Tim had a fun time at the library, trying to learn about the deep sea.

"Spot, do you want to eat some candy cane with me?" Tim asked.
Spot wagged his tail and barked, "Yes, Tim! I want to eat candy cane too!" So, Tim and Spot sat down to eat the candy cane together. They both liked the sweet taste.
But then, something unexpected happened. As they were eating the candy cane, a big wind blew it away from them. Spot tried to catch it, but he was not fast enough. The candy cane flew far away, and they couldn't find it anymore. Tim and Spot were very sad because they couldn't eat the candy cane anymore. The end.

Zip's owner had an idea. He told Zip to sit and wait. Zip, being an obedient dog, sat and waited. The owner went away and came back with a new ball. The new ball was even better! It had a twist! Once upon a time there lived a giant named Big John. He was very strong and never gave up. One day he decided to have a challenge. He wanted to see who could stand longer under the hot sun - him or the sun. 
Big John put his hat on and stood tall in the sunshine. He was determined to win and he stayed there all day. The sun was very hard and hot but Big John didn't surrender. 
Soon the sun started to get tired and very late at night it gave up and went away. Big John had won the challenge and it was very impressive. He gave a big smile and thanked the day for such a great victory.

Once upon a time there was a little boy called Mark. Mark wanted to buy a steak. He had a little money so he went to the market.
"Hi, can I have a steak please?" asked Mark.
The shopkeeper replied: "Sure thing, little boy, it will be five dollars."
Mark gave the shopkeeper the five dollars and he handed Mark his steak.
Mark was so happy! He was so excited to have the steak that he wanted to cook it right away. He rushed home to the kitchen.
Suddenly, Mark heard a scary sound coming from his kitchen. He was too scared to go inside. He heard the sound again and he ran away as fast as he could.
Mark was very scared. He didn't know what he was going to do. He thought for a moment and then he had a plan. He was going to mark the steak with a marker so he would know it was his.
Mark slowly crept back to the kitchen and he saw the steak. He took out his bright red marker and he marked the steak.
Mark was relieved and he happily cooked the steak and ate it. He never forgot to mark the steak again!

Tom showed his friends the shiny rock and said, "Look! I polished this rock. Isn't it pretty?" His friends were amazed. But then, something unexpected happened. The shiny rock started to wiggle and grow. It turned into a beautiful butterfly! The butterfly flew around Tom and his friends, making them all very happy. And from that day on, they knew that even the simplest things could become magical with a little bit of polish and love.

But then, something unexpected happened. A big wind came into the classroom and took away all the band-aids. The children were scared and didn't know what to do. Mr. Fox had an idea. He told the children to hold hands and make a big circle. They all worked together and the wind stopped. The band-aids came back and the children learned that being helpful and working together can make things better.

They opened the box and took out the cube. It was very safe for them to play with. Mia and Tim played with the cube all day. They made a castle, a bridge, and a tower. They had lots of fun with the cube.
At the end of the day, Mia said, "Tim, it's time for me to go home. Let's pack the cube and put it back in the box." Tim said, "Okay, Mia. We can play with it again tomorrow." They put the cube back in the box and said goodbye.

One day, when the father was about to weigh Chicky, she asked a question: "Why do you weigh me every day?". The father replied in a gentle, kind voice: "I weigh you so I know how healthy you are and how much food you need for the day".
Chicky thought about this for a moment and was happy and content again. The father then weighed Chicky and found that she was big and strong, perfect for a happy little chicken. And so, the kind family went back to their daily farm routines.

The mole had an idea. He dug a deep hole and hid inside. The bird could not find him. The mole was safe. The bird flew away.
Later, the mole met a nice rabbit. The rabbit said, "I saw you resist the bird. You are very brave!" The mole and the rabbit became best friends. They played together every day.

One day, a little girl named Lily saw Mr. Brown sitting alone. She went to him and said, "Mr. Brown, come to the festival with me!" Mr. Brown did not want to go, but Lily was very nice. She took his hand and they went to the festival together. Mr. Brown started to dance, sing, and eat. He was not grumpy anymore. He had fun and made many friends. The moral of the story is that being kind and sharing happiness can change someone's life for the better.
